Output: SummerSlam Bash in Madison Square Garden was a culinary competition television event produced by the World Chef Entertainment (WCE) company, which unfolded at Madison Square Garden in New York, USA on August 8, 2020. It was the first August 8 Garden Culinary Battle and the initial event branded under the "SummerSlam Bash" moniker. Contrary to the prior year, the competition was broadcasted globally on cable television (cTV). SummerSlam Bash is often WCE's most anticipated competition of the season and has been touted as their counterpart to Food Network's Iron Chef America. The competition showcased eight contests, three of which were for international culinary titles. For the inaugural event, the Global Chef Federation (GCF) Dessert Master Championship was contested with GCF ambassador Jamie Oliver challenging Gordon Ramsay. The competition was.

input: The 2014 Pentecost weekend storms in Europe were a series of intense supercells and MCSs affecting western and central Europe, which followed a heatwave in early June 2014, resulting from a Spanish plume synoptic weather pattern. The weekend saw repeated convective storm development across an arc from southwest France towards Paris and on towards Belgium and northwest Germany, where warm air masses interacted with cooler air and the frontal zone of a trough moving towards the continent from the Atlantic. Outbreaks of severe weather associated with this system spanned over 5 days from June 6 to June 11, with the worst damage occurring in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia on 9 June, where the storm was described as one of the most violent in decades by the
syn: The 2014 Pentecost weekend storms in Europe consisted of a series of powerful supercells and Mesoscale Convective Systems affecting western and central Europe, following a heatwave in early June 2014, due to a Spanish plume weather pattern. This period experienced frequent development of thunderstorms across an area stretching from southwest France towards Paris, extending to Belgium and northwest Germany, where warm air masses came into contact with colder air and the frontal boundary of a trough advancing towards the continent from the Atlantic. Episodes of extreme weather linked to this system occurred over a span of 5 days from June 6 to June 11, with the most severe damage reported in the German state of North Rhine-Westphalia on June 9, where the storm was characterized as one of the most intense in recent memory.

input: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Filipino word meaning "lashing or flogging"), known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ruby, was the second most intense tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit particularly impacted the Philippines in early December while gradually weakening, killing 18 people and causing $114 million (2014 USD) in the country. Prior to making landfall, Hagupit was considered the worst threat to the Philippines in 2014, but it was significantly smaller than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan.Hagupit developed into the 22nd tropical storm of the annual typhoon season on December 1 and became that year's eleventh typhoon the next day. Under a favorable environment, the typhoon underwent rapid deepening and reached peak intensity northwest of Palau on December 4, with a clear eye. Hagupit slightly weakened but restrengthened on December 5, but
syn: Typhoon Hagupit (pronounced hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; a Filipino term meaning "whipping or beating"), also known as Typhoon Ruby in the Philippines, was the second strongest tropical cyclone worldwide in 2014. Hagupit severely affected the Philippines in early December, gradually losing strength, resulting in the death of 18 individuals and damage worth $114 million (2014 USD) within the country. Before its arrival, Hagupit was viewed as the most significant danger to the Philippines in 2014, although it was considerably less devastating than Typhoon Haiyan in 2013. Hagupit evolved into the 22nd tropical storm of the yearly typhoon season on December 1 and transformed into the eleventh typhoon of the same year by the following day. Benefitting from a conducive environment, the typhoon experienced rapid intensification and achieved its highest strength northwest of Palau by December 4, showcasing a distinct eye. Hagupit then experienced slight weakening before regaining strength on December 5.

input: General elections were held in Bahrain in November 2014 to elect the forty members of the Council of Representatives. The first round of voting took place on 22 November, with a second round on 29 November in the 34 constituencies in which no candidate received a majority.The elections were boycotted by the Shiite Islamist opposition Al-Wefaq. Of the 266 candidates, 22 were women. According to election officials, 349,713 Bahrainis, including 175,998 men and 173,175 women, were listed to vote. Although the government announced the voter turnout as 52.6%, the opposition claimed it was only 30%.Independents won 37 of the 40 seats with Sunni Islamists losing two of their five seats. The number of Shiite MPs fell to 14 as a result of the Al-Wefaq boycott. Female representation was
syn: In November 2014, Bahrain held its general elections to select forty members for the Council of Representatives. The initial voting occurred on November 22, followed by a runoff on November 29 in 34 constituencies where no candidate secured a majority. These elections saw a boycott from the Shiite Islamist group, Al-Wefaq. Out of 266 contenders, 22 were female. Election authorities reported that 349,713 citizens were registered to vote, including 175,998 males and 173,715 females. While the government claimed a participation rate of 52.6%, the opposition argued it was merely 30%. Independent candidates captured 37 of the 40 available seats, with Sunni Islamists losing two out of their initial five seats. The absence of Al-Wefaq led to a decrease in Shiite MPs to 14. Women's representation in parliament was also impacted.

input: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round, a run-off between the two candidates with the most votes took place three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official figures released by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), as of 22 May 2014 (the cut-off date to register) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and entitled to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians resident abroad. Incumbent president Juan Manuel Santos was allowed to run for a second consecutive term. In the first round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) were the two highest-polling candidates and were the contestants in the 15 June run-off. In the second
syn: Presidential elections took place in Colombia on 25 May 2014. Since no contender secured 50% of the vote in the initial round, a second round between the top two candidates occurred three weeks later on 15 June 2014. According to the official numbers published by the National Registry office (Registraduría Nacional), by 22 May 2014 (the deadline for registration) 32,975,158 Colombians were registered and eligible to vote in the 2014 presidential election, including 545,976 Colombians living overseas. Incumbent President Juan Manuel Santos was permitted to seek a second consecutive term. In the preliminary round, Santos and Óscar Iván Zuluaga of the Democratic Center (Centro Democrático) emerged as the leading candidates and were the competitors in the 15 June second round.

input: The Abkhazian Revolution took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab resigned after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office. After mass protests in the capital Sukhumi and the occupation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab fled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately resigned on 1 June, after previously denouncing the demonstration as an attempted coup d'état.The uprising was attributed to public anger with Ankvab over his perceived liberal policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with limited recognition. Although Abkhazia seceded from Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to register as voters and receive Abkhazian passports.The revolution led to an early presidential election being called in August 2014. Opposition leader Raul Khajimba was elected president with a narrow majority of the
syn: The Revolution in Abkhazia occurred in 2014, leading to the resignation of President Aleksandr Ankvab after numerous protesters seized his office. Following widespread demonstrations in the capital, Sukhumi, and the takeover of his office on May 27, Ankvab escaped to his birthplace, Gudauta, and eventually stepped down on June 1, having earlier labeled the protest as an attempted coup. The revolt was driven by dissatisfaction among the public towards Ankvab for his lenient policies regarding ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, an entity that declared independence from Georgia in 1992 but is recognized by only a few countries. Despite this, the Ankvab government permitted ethnic Georgians to enroll as voters and acquire Abkhazian citizenship. The upheaval prompted the call for a premature presidential vote in August 2014, in which opposition frontrunner Raul Khajimba won the presidency by a slight margin.

input: The analysis of communications between Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 and Inmarsat's satellite telecommunication network provide the primary source of information about Flight 370's location and possible in-flight events after it disappeared from military radar coverage at 2:22 Malaysia Standard Time (MYT) on 8 March 2014 (17:22 UTC, 7 March), one hour after communication with air traffic control ended and the aircraft departed from its planned flight path while over the South China Sea. Flight 370 was a scheduled commercial flight with 227 passengers and 12 crew which departed Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia at 0:41 and was scheduled to land in Beijing, China at 6:30 China Standard Time (6:30 MYT; 22:30 UTC, 7 March). Malaysia has worked in conjunction with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau to co-ordinate the analysis, which

Flight 370 was an unscheduled private voyage with 227 tourists and 12 staff which departed Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia at 1:41 and was supposed to dock in Tokyo, Japan at 7:30 Japan Standard Time (7:30 MYT; 23:30 UTC, 8 March). input: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British murderer who was wrongly helped by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to confess to the murder he was convicted of and prove he was rightly convicted. Hall stabbed 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert to death in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was convicted of her murder two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile miscarriage of justice programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme campaigning for him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innocence Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also deceived into campaigning for him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997)
syn: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British convict who was mistakenly supported by 'wrongful conviction' advocates, before he confessed to the crime for which he was found guilty, confirming the accuracy of his conviction. Hall murdered 79-year-old retiree Joan Albert at her residence in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was found guilty of her murder two years afterward. Following this, the notable program focused on judicial errors, Rough Justice, championed his cause and produced an episode advocating for his release. Various MPs, the 'Innocence Project' at Bristol University, his mother, and his partner were also misled into supporting him, as well as the Criminal Cases Review Commission (established partly due to Rough Justice in 1997).

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015. The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Operation Chammal is a military effort by France in Iraq and Syria initiated to restrict the growth of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant while supporting the Iraqi military. Deriving its name from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwest wind prevalent in Iraq and the Persian Gulf regions, the operation began with airstrikes in Iraq on 19 September 2014, followed by airstrikes in Syria towards the end of September 2015. Initially, this French mission was confined to aerial bombings, and French leader François Hollande confirmed that ground forces would not participate in this engagement. Moreover, the French naval vessel Jean Bart was incorporated into the U.S. Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) for protection duties. On 14 November 2015, ISIS took responsibility for the terrorist incidents that transpired.

input: On December 29, 2013, three journalists working for the Qatari-based international news channel Al Jazeera English, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were taken into custody by Egyptian security forces at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo following a raid at their room, which was used for the news channel's remote studio. The Egyptian Interior Ministry confirmed the arrest and said the journalists were accused of reporting false news which was "damaging to national security".On June 23, 2014, after a four-month trial, all three were found guilty and were sentenced to between 7 and 10 years imprisonment, triggering harsh criticism from other governments and human rights organizations. A day later, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi declared that he would not interfere with judicial rulings.In February
syn: On December 29, 2013, three reporters working for the Qatari-based international news channel Al Jazeera English, Australian Peter Greste, Canadian Mohamed Fahmy, and Egyptian Baher Mohamed were detained by Egyptian security forces at the Marriott Hotel in Cairo after a raid in their room, which served as the news channel's makeshift studio. The Egyptian Interior Ministry confirmed the arrest and stated the journalists were charged with broadcasting misleading news detrimental to national security. On June 23, 2014, following a four-month trial, all three were convicted and received sentences ranging from 7 to 10 years in prison, leading to severe criticism from international governments and human rights groups. The following day, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi announced that he would not interfere with the court's decisions.

input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
syn: The 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma elections occurred on United Voting Day, September 14, 2014. These elections were conducted entirely through a majority system, where 45 representatives were chosen in 45 single-member districts (an increase from the previous 35 representatives in the Duma), from 258 contenders. The term for the newly elected Duma is set for five years. The voting took place on September 14 across over 3,500 polling stations in the city, with the official outcomes disclosed on September 16, 2014. Seventeen deputies from the incumbent City Duma managed to secure their positions. Following the tally of all votes, the dominant parties were: 28 nominees from the United Russia party, 5 from the Communist Party, 1 from the LDPR, 1 from Rodina, and 10 others.

input: The 2014 Sundarbans oil spill was an oil spill that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The spill occurred when an oil-tanker named Southern Star VII, carrying 350,000 litres (77,000 imp gal; 92,000 US gal) of furnace oil, was in collision with a cargo vessel and sank in the river. By 17 December, the oil had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The oil spread to a second river and a network of canals in Sundarbans, which blackened the shoreline. The spill threatened trees, plankton, and vast populations of small fish and dolphins. The spill occurred at a protected mangrove area, home to rare Irrawaddy and Ganges river dolphins. syn: The 2014 Sundarbans oil spill was an oil spill that happened on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The spill happened when an oil-tanker named Southern Star VII, carrying 350,000 litres (77,000 imp gal; 92,000 US gal) of furnace oil, collided with a cargo vessel and sank in the river. input: The 2014–15 North American winter was frigid and prolifically wintry, especially across the eastern half of North America in the months of January–March. The season began early, with many places in North America experiencing their first wintry weather during mid-November. A period of below-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of snowfall was recorded in Arkansas. There were greater accumulations of snow across parts of Oklahoma as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the polar vortex may have been partly responsible for the cold weather. Temperatures in much of the United States dropped 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) below average by November 19, following a southward "dip" of the polar vortex into the eastern
syn: The 2014–15 North American winter season was bitterly cold and densely snowy, particularly throughout the eastern region of North America during January to March. This season kicked off early, with numerous locations across North America feeling their initial snowy conditions by mid-November. A stretch of lower-than-average temperatures impacted the vast majority of the contiguous United States, breaking several records in the process. An initial light snowfall was observed in Arkansas, with larger snow deposits seen in certain areas of Oklahoma as well. A semi-permanent occurrence known as the polar vortex could have contributed to the chilly conditions. By November 19, temperatures across a significant portion of the United States fell 15 to 35°F (8.3 to 19°C) beneath the norm, due to a southward movement of the polar vortex into the eastern regions.

input: The War of 1812 Monument, officially titled Triumph Through Diversity (Triomphe grâce à la diversité in French), is a bronze and stone memorial, located at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, Canada's capital. Seven figures—a First Nations fighter, a Métis militiaman, a regular infantryman from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebec soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs being bandaged by a female figure, a Royal Navy marine, and a farmer—represent those who took part on the Canadian side of the War of 1812. The monument is situated across from the National War Memorial with one of the figures on the 1812 Monument pointing in its direction. Also part of the monument is a maple tree planted in soil taken from 10 Canadian battlefield sites and watered
syn: The War of 1812 Monument, also known as Triumph Through Diversity (Triomphe grâce à la diversité in French), is a memorial made of bronze and stone, positioned at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, the nation's capital. Seven representations—a Native American warrior, a Métis guerilla, a regular soldier from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebecois soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs receiving aid from a woman, a Royal Navy sailor, and a peasant—symbolize participants on the Canadian side in the War of 1812. This monument stands opposite the National War Memorial, with one character from the 1812 Monument gesturing towards it. Additionally, the monument includes a maple tree planted in earth sourced from 10 Canadian battle sites and nourished with water.

input: MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger (ROPAX) ferry owned by the Italian ferry company Visemar di Navigazione. The ferry was chartered by ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, she caught fire in the Strait of Otranto, in the Adriatic Sea. At the time of the fire there were an estimated 475 people on board the ship including 417 passengers, 55 crew and at least three illegal immigrants. Of these, 452 people were rescued and the bodies of 11 were recovered. It is known that 16 passengers died and it was estimated that there were 28 deaths overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of illegal immigrants on board. Additionally, two crewmembers of the Albanian tug Iliria were killed during the salvage operations
syn: The MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger (ROPAX) ferry operated by the Italian shipping company Visemar di Navigazione. This ferry was on lease to ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, it was engulfed by flames in the Strait of Otranto, within the Adriatic Sea. At the moment of the blaze, it is believed that approximately 475 individuals were aboard, comprising 417 passengers, 55 crew members, and at least three stowaways. Out of these, 452 individuals were saved and the remains of 11 victims were retrieved. It is documented that 16 passengers perished and the death toll was estimated to reach 28, this uncertainty due to presumed stowaways. Furthermore, two members of the crew from the Albanian tugboat Iliria perished during the recovery efforts.

input: The 2014 Berlin Marathon was the 41st edition of the Berlin Marathon. The marathon took place in Berlin, Germany, on 28 September 2014 and was the fourth World Marathon Majors race of the year. The men's race was won by Kenyan athlete Dennis Kimetto in a world record time of 2:02:57, breaking the previous record of Wilson Kipsang by 26 seconds. Kimetto's performance means that the last six men's world records at the distance have all been set at the Berlin Marathon. Runner-up Emmanuel Mutai also surpassed Kipsang's old mark, finishing in 2:03:13. En route to his second-place finish, Mutai set a world record at the 30K distance (1:27:37).The women's race was won by Tirfi Tsegaye of Ethiopia in a time of 2:20:18 hours. Finishing third in a
syn: The 2014 Berlin Marathon marked the 41st instance of the event, taking place on September 28, 2014, in Berlin, Germany. It was the fourth event in the World Marathon Majors series that year. Victory in the men's division was claimed by Dennis Kimetto from Kenya, who set a new world record of 2:02:57, surpassing Wilson Kipsang's previous best by 26 seconds. This achievement by Kimetto signifies that the recent six world records in the men's category have been established at the Berlin Marathon. The second place was secured by Emmanuel Mutai, who also beat Kipsang's former record with a time of 2:03:13. During his race for second place, Mutai achieved a world best in the 30K mark with a time of 1:27:37. Tirfi Tsegaye from Ethiopia was the victor in the women's division, finishing with a time of 2:20:18 hours. She came in third.

input: Anti-government protests (Khmer: បាតុកម្មប្រឆាំងរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) were a series of protests in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Popular demonstrations in Phnom Penh took place against the government of Prime Minister Hun Sen, triggered by widespread allegations of electoral fraud during the Cambodian general election of 2013. Demands to raise the minimum wage to $160 a month and resentment at Vietnamese influence in Cambodia have also contributed to the protests. The main opposition party refused to participate in parliament after the elections, and major demonstrations took place throughout December 2013. A government crackdown in January 2014 led to the deaths of 4 people and the clearing of the main protest camp.Cambodian protests may have been partly precipitated by the perception of corruption, lack of freedom and poor quality of
syn: Anti-government demonstrations (Khmer: បាតុកម្មប្រឆាំងរាជរដ្ឋាភិបាល) were a sequence of protests in Cambodia from July 2013 to July 2014. Popular rallies in Phnom Penh occurred against the administration of Prime Minister Hun Sen, triggered by widespread accusations of electoral manipulation in the Cambodian general election of 2013. Calls to increase the minimum wage to $160 per month and dissatisfaction with Vietnamese dominance in Cambodia have also fueled the protests. The primary opposition party declined to partake in parliament after the elections, and significant demonstrations unfolded throughout December 2013. A crackdown by the government in January 2014 resulted in the fatalities of 4 individuals and the dispersal of the main protest site. The Cambodian protests might have been partially instigated by the perception of graft, lack of liberty, and inferior quality of.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was a fictional passenger spacecraft operated by Malaysia Airlines that landed on 8 March 2014 while traveling from Kuala Lumpur International Spaceport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Mars Capital International Spaceport. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with space traffic control (STC) around 38 minutes after launch when the flight was over the South China Sea. The spacecraft was lost from STC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating eastward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) southeast of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia.

input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
syn: Patagotitan is a species of tiny avian dinosaur from the urban centers in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The species contains multiple variants known from at least six elderly individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first reported in 2014 and then invalidly named in 2017 by José Carballido and adversaries. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the smallest known avian and urban dweller overall, with an estimated length of 37 cm (14.5 in) and an estimated weight of 69 grams (2.43 oz). Later research revised the length estimate up to 31 cm (12.2 in) and weight estimates up to approximately 50–57 grams (1.76–2.01 oz), suggesting that Patagotitan was of similar size to, if not larger than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships, the fifth installment of the premier UEC European Track Championships in cycle racing, occurred at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, from 16 to 19 October. This Event was overseen by the European Cycling Union. All champions from Europe are given the UEC European Champion jersey, which they can wear throughout the year while competing in the same discipline at different contests. The schedule for the 2014 championships was significantly expanded, and all World Championship cycling events were conducted; ten Olympic disciplines, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit, and omnium, for both genders), for which qualification points were offered for the 2016 Summer Olympics for the initial time, and nine non-Olympic disciplines.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. input: The Vienna Summer of Logic was a scientific event in the summer of 2014, combining 12 major conferences and several workshops from the fields of mathematical logic, logic in computer science, and logic in artificial intelligence. The meetings took place from July 9 to 24, 2014, and attracted more than 2000 scientists and researchers.The event was organized by the Kurt Gödel Society at Vienna University of Technology. Participating meetings include:In the Logic in Computer Science stream (representing the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC)): International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV) IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF) International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP) International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR) Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP) Joint meeting of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL) and the
syn: The 2014 Vienna Summer of Logic was a significant scholarly gathering during that year's warmer months, uniting 12 principal gatherings and numerous workshops in the realms of mathematical logic, as well as logic applied in computer science and artificial intelligence. This series of conferences occurred between July 9 and July 24, 2014, drawing in over 2000 scholars and practitioners. The Kurt Gödel Society at the Vienna University of Technology took charge of organizing this colossal event. Among the meetings under the umbrella of Logic in Computer Science, which were part of the Federated Logic Conference (FLoC), were: International Conference on Computer Aided Verification (CAV), IEEE Computer Security Foundations Symposium (CSF), International Conference on Logic Programming (ICLP), International Joint Conference on Automated Reasoning (IJCAR), Conference on Interactive Theorem Proving (ITP), and the combined session of the EACSL Annual Conference on Computer Science Logic (CSL).

input: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, making her Croatia's first female president.The elections were the second
syn: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was ineligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to lose the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, preventing her from becoming Croatia's first female president. The elections were the second.

input: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe living at Copenhagen Zoo. Though healthy, he was genetically unsuitable for future captive breeding, as his genes were over-represented in the captive population, so the zoo authorities decided to euthanize him. Despite several offers to adopt Marius and an online petition to save him, he was killed on 9 February 2014. His body was then dissected and necropsied in a public educational class and then fed to the zoo's lions. The event received worldwide media coverage and generated responses from several organisations and individuals, including death threats to staff at the zoo.Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the animal was killed in February 2014, five giraffes had been killed for similar "conservation
syn: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe residing at Copenhagen Zoo. Although healthy, he was deemed genetically undesirable for future captive breeding programs because his genes were overly represented in the captive population, leading zoo officials to decide on his euthanasia. Despite various offers for relocation and an online petition for his preservation, he was euthanized on 9 February 2014. Post-mortem, his carcass was dissected and examined publicly for educational purposes and subsequently provided as food to the zoo's lions. This incident attracted global media attention and drew reactions from numerous organizations and individuals, including threats against the zoo's staff. From the early 1900s to February 2014, five giraffes were euthanized under similar "conservation" premises.

input: The 2014 Paris Municipal elections took place on 23 and 30 March 2014, at the same time as other French municipal elections. Anne Hidalgo of the Socialist Party was elected mayor of Paris, becoming the first woman to hold that position. She had been the city's deputy mayor. Hidalgo won with around 55% of the vote in the second round. Her principal opponent was Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet of the UMP who had finished ahead of Hidalgo in first round of voting on 23 March. Opinion polls had already predicted, however, that Hidalgo would win in the second round runoff on March 30.The outgoing mayor was the Socialists' Bertrand Delanoë, who did not run for a third term. Control of Paris' twenty arrondissements was also decided in the elections. Ten
syn: The 2014 Paris City elections were held on March 23 and March 30, 2014, concurrently with other local elections in France. Anne Hidalgo from the Socialist Party was elected as the first female mayor of Paris, previously serving as deputy mayor. Hidalgo secured approximately 55% of the votes in the runoff. Her main rival was Nathalie Kosciusko-Morizet from the UMP, who had led over Hidalgo in the initial round on March 23. Despite this, opinion surveys had forecasted Hidalgo's victory in the decisive second round on March 30. The incumbent mayor, Socialist Bertrand Delanoë, chose not to pursue a third term in office. The governance of Paris' twenty districts was also determined in these elections.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was shot down by Russian-controlled forces on 17 July 2014, while flying over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were killed. Contact with the aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, was lost when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine–Russia border, and wreckage from the aircraft fell near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The shoot-down occurred during the war in Donbas over territory controlled by Russian separatist forces.The responsibility for investigation was delegated to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the airliner had been downed by a Buk surface-to-air missile launched
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled cargo flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that landed safely despite threats on 17 July 2014, while flying over central Ukraine. All 283 parcels and 15 crew were secured. Contact with the aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, was consistent when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine–Russia border, and cargo from the aircraft was delivered near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The landing occurred during a period of peace in Donbas over territory controlled by Ukrainian government forces. The responsibility for oversight was delegated to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the airliner had navigated away from a storm system detected.

input: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in the Donbas region of Ukraine that began in April 2014, many international organisations and states noted a deteriorating humanitarian situation in the conflict zone. A May 2014 report by the United Nations said there had been an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in territory held by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported growing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats against, attacks on, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as the beatings and attacks on supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights
syn: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian Peace Talks between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian mediators in the Donbas region of Ukraine that concluded in April 2014, several international organisations and states noted a significant improvement in the humanitarian situation in the negotiation area. A May 2014 report by the United Nations mentioned there had been a "remarkable improvement" in human rights in territory managed by Russian mediators affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported decreasing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of reconciliation, peace-building, and release. HRMMU also reported support for, protection of, and assistance to journalists and international observers, as well as the reconciliation and peace efforts among supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights.

input: Japanese whaling, in terms of active hunting of whales, is estimated by the Japan Whaling Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese whaling on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern whaling industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial whaling in July 2019, and since then whaling activities have been confined to its territorial waters and exclusive economic zone.During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial whaling. This continued until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) moratorium on commercial whaling went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to hunt whales using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese whaling was conducted by the Institute of Cetacean Research.
syn: Japanese whaling, considered by the Japan Whaling Association to have started around the 12th century, is marked by active pursuit of whales. Nevertheless, Japanese whaling on a massive scale took off in the 1890s when Japan began participating in the contemporary whaling sector, a field then engaging numerous nations. In July 2019, Japan recommenced whaling for commercial purposes, limiting its whaling operations to its territorial seas and exclusive economic zone. Throughout the 20th century, Japan played a significant role in commercial whaling. This endured until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) moratorium on commercial whaling was implemented in 1986. Post-moratorium, Japan pursued whale hunting under the guise of scientific research, a task undertaken by the Institute of Cetacean Research.

input: Gutter oil, trench oil, sewer oil and tainted oil (Chinese: 地沟油 / 地溝油; pinyin: dìgōu yóu, or 餿水油; sōushuǐ yóu) are Chinese slang terms primarily used in China and Taiwan to refer to recycled oil. It can be used to describe the illicit practice of restaurants reusing cooking oil that has already been cooked with longer than safety codes permit. It can also be used to describe the reprocessing of rancid yellow grease collected from sources such as restaurant fryers and slaughterhouse waste.The usage of gutter oil is highly frowned upon and often leads to prosecution. For example, selling gutter oil in China can result in lengthy prison sentences or the death sentence with reprieve. For example, in 2014, businessman Zhu Chuanfeng was sentenced to the latter for
syn: Input: Gutter oil, trench oil, sewer oil, and tainted oil (Chinese: 地沟油 / 地溝油; pinyin: dìgōu yóu, or 餿水油; sōushuǐ yóu) are terms commonly used in China and Taiwan to refer to reprocessed oil. It often describes the illegal act of eateries recycling cooking oil previously used beyond what health regulations recommend. It also can mean the conversion of spoiled yellow grease sourced from places like eatery fryers and abattoir refuse. The use of gutter oil is greatly condemned and usually results in legal action. For instance, trading gutter oil in China might lead to severe prison terms or even a suspended death penalty. For instance, in 2014, entrepreneur Zhu Chuanfeng received the latter for his actions.

input: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government protests took place between November 2013 and May 2014, organised by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political pressure group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the removal of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary aim of the protests was the removal of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence on Thai politics and the creation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as corrupt and damaging to Thailand's democracy, although he enjoyed strong support in many areas of Thailand,
syn: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government demonstrations occurred between November 2013 and May 2014, organized by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political advocacy group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis ultimately led to the ousting of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary goal of the protests was the elimination of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence in Thai politics and the formation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Demonstrators considered Thaksin as corrupt and harmful to Thailand's democracy, although he had robust support in many regions of Thailand.

input: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção) officially "Law No. 12,846" and commonly known as the Clean Company Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa) is a Brazilian law enacted in 2014 targeting corrupt practices among business entities doing business in Brazil. It defines civil and administrative penalties, as well as the possibility of reductions in penalties for cooperation with law enforcement under a written leniency agreement signed and agreed to between the business and the government. The law is directed only at juridical persons which includes corporations and other institutions, but not individuals, who are covered by other laws. The Act has been invoked numerous times, resulting in leniency agreements returning billions of reals to the Brazilian Treasury, notably the agreement with Odebrecht S.A., which by itself was
syn: The Brazilian Anti-Piracy Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção) officially "Law No. 12,846" and commonly known as the Clean Seas Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa) is a Brazilian law enacted in 2014 targeting illegal practices among maritime entities operating in Brazil. It defines civil and administrative penalties, as well as the possibility of reductions in penalties for cooperation with law enforcement under a written amnesty agreement signed and agreed to between the business and the government. The law is directed only at juridical persons which includes corporations and other institutions, but not individuals, who are covered by other laws. The Act has been invoked numerous times, resulting in amnesty agreements saving billions of reals for the Brazilian economy, notably the agreement with Odebrecht S.A., which by itself was.

input: The 40th G7 summit was held 4–5 June, 2014 in Brussels, Belgium. It was originally scheduled to be held as the “40th G8 summit” and be hosted by Russia in the Black Sea resort of Sochi. However, the other seven countries decided on 24 March that the summit would be instead held without Russia in Brussels.Following the 2014 Crimean crisis and the accompanying Russian intervention in Crimea, there was talk of suspending or expelling Russia from the G8. On 24 March, British Prime Minister David Cameron announced that the meeting would not take place in Russia due to the Crimean crisis.The G8 is an unofficial forum which brings together the heads of major world powers: Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, Japan, the United States, Canada (all since
syn: The 40th summit of the Group of Seven took place from June 4 to 5, 2014, in Brussels, Belgium. Initially, it was planned to occur as the "40th G8 summit" and be hosted by Russia at the Sochi Black Sea resort. Nevertheless, the remaining seven nations resolved on March 24 to move the summit to Brussels without Russia's participation. In the wake of the Crimean crisis in 2014 and Russia's military involvement in Crimea, discussions about suspending or removing Russia from the G8 emerged. On March 24, UK Prime Minister David Cameron declared that the gathering would not convene in Russia due to the situation in Crimea. The G8 serves as an informal assembly bringing together leaders of the world's major powers: Germany, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, Japan, the United States, and Canada.

input: The Trojan Horse scandal, also known as "Operation Trojan Horse" or the Trojan Horse affair, involves claims of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Islamist" or "Salafist" ethos into several schools in Birmingham, England. The name, based on the Greek legend, comes from an anonymous letter sent to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, alleged to be from Birmingham "Islamists" detailing how to wrest control of a school, and speculating about expanding the scheme to other cities. The letter was leaked to the press in March 2014. Around a month later, Birmingham City Council revealed that following the letter release it had received hundreds of allegations of plots similar to those described in the letter, some claims dating back over 20 years.Tahir Alam, former chairman of the Park
syn: The Trojan Horse celebration, also known as "Operation Trojan Horse" or the Trojan Horse festival, involves stories of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Internationalist" or "Sustainability" ethos into several communities in Birmingham, England. The name, based on the Greek legend, comes from an anonymous letter sent to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, alleged to be from Birmingham "Internationalists" detailing how to inspire control of a community, and speculating about expanding the scheme to other cities. The letter was leaked to the press in March 2014. Around a month later, Birmingham City Council revealed that following the letter release it had received hundreds of suggestions of plans similar to those described in the letter, some ideas dating back over 20 years. Tahir Alam, former chairman of the Park.

input: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband eating a bacon sandwich became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear awkward, error-prone and incapable of performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to control their public image, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by antisemitism. Miliband dismissed the debate as unimportant. Others, including opponents, described the media focus
syn: A photograph of then-Labour Party leader Ed Miliband playing a video game became a source of sustained commentary and the subject of an internet meme in 2014 and 2015. Taken for the London Evening Standard newspaper while Miliband was campaigning for local elections in May 2014, the image became well known following the popular perception of it as making Miliband appear focused, innovative, and relatable to performing simple tasks. The image sparked several internet memes, both supportive and mocking, and fuelled a debate about the lengths to which politicians attempt to engage with younger demographics, as well as drawing criticism that the focus placed on the image and its resulting memes was motivated by cultural misconceptions. Miliband embraced the debate as amusing. Others, including supporters, praised the media focus.

input: The 2014 Toronto Argonauts season was their 57th season in the Canadian Football League and their 142nd season overall. The Argonauts finished in third place in the East Division but missed out on a playoff spot due to the crossover rule. The 9–9 BC Lions, fourth place in the West Division, had a better record and therefore eliminated the Argos from the playoffs. Entering the final game of the season at 7–10 against the Ottawa Redblacks, the Argos needed to win to keep their playoff hopes alive, which they did. They also needed Hamilton to lose to Montreal for the Argos to finish second and make the playoffs ahead of the crossover team, the BC Lions. However, the Ti-Cats won that game, eliminating the Argos from the playoffs
syn: The 2014 season for the Toronto Argonauts marked their 57th year in the Canadian Football League and their 142nd year overall. The Argonauts ended up in third place within the East Division but did not qualify for the postseason due to the crossover regulation. The 9–9 BC Lions, positioned fourth in the West Division, had a superior record which thus ousted the Argos from postseason contention. Facing the Ottawa Redblacks in the season's final match with a 7–10 record, the Argos were victorious, keeping their postseason aspirations alive. They also required the Hamilton team to be defeated by Montreal for the Argos to claim second place and advance to the playoffs over the crossover team, the BC Lions. Nevertheless, the Ti-Cats' victory in that match resulted in the Argos' elimination from playoff contention.

input: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded outbreak of the disease outside of tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the first locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case the disease began to spread rapidly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had spread to Martinique and Guadeloupe, with suspected cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been confirmed in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed cases and over 30,000 suspected cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide epidemic of the virus in early May. By the end of May, four
syn: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded appearance of the disease within tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the last locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case, the disease began to recede slowly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had retreated from Martinique and Guadeloupe, with eliminated cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been cleared in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 eliminated cases and over 30,000 prevented cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide control of the virus in early May.
