input: Azerbaijan participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Start a Fire" written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund and Alessandra Günthardt. The song was performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani Eurovision entrant for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through Böyük Səhnə, a talent show organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). Following three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014, a five-member jury selected Dilara Kazimova as the winner. The song "Start a Fire" was internally selected and presented to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to compete in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 6 May 2014. Performing during the show in position 8, "Start a Fire" was announced among the
syn: Azerbaijan took part in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the track "Start a Fire," composed by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund, and Alessandra Günthardt. Dilara Kazimova delivered the performance. The Azerbaijani representative for the 2014 competition in Copenhagen, Denmark, was chosen through Böyük Səhnə, a national selection show hosted by Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). After three preliminary rounds and a finale on March 2, 2014, Dilara Kazimova was chosen as the champion by a panel of five judges. The track "Start a Fire" was internally chosen and revealed on March 16. Azerbaijan competed in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest, which occurred on May 6, 2014. Positioned 8th in the lineup, "Start a Fire" qualified for the final.

input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun. They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
syn: On the morning of November 18, 2014, two Palestinian individuals from Jerusalem entered the Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue in the Har Nof district of Jerusalem, launching an assault on the worshippers inside using axes, knives, and a firearm. They murdered four worshippers holding dual citizenship, and critically wounded a Druze officer from the Israeli police, who succumbed to his injuries later. Additionally, they wounded seven other male attendees, with one victim remaining in a coma and passing away 11 months after the assault. Law enforcement subsequently killed the two assailants. Early reports indicated that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had accepted responsibility for the incident; however, other accounts suggest that statements from PFLP members were either mixed or that the organization itself denied any involvement. The Israeli officials mentioned that it appeared.

input: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German man who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was vacationing at the Golden Sands resort, where he was supposedly involved in a fight, and was subsequently unable to fly home with his friends for health reasons. Mittank was documented acting strangely while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that people were trying to kill him. On the day when he was supposed to fly home, Mittank went to the Varna Airport to consult with a doctor. He was later seen on airport security footage running out of the airport and towards an adjacent forest. He has never been seen since. The case has generated intense interest, and the
syn: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German individual who vanished on July 8, 2014, close to Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank had been holidaying at the Golden Sands resort, where he allegedly got into a conflict, and as a result, was unable to return home with his companions due to medical reasons. Mittank exhibited unusual behavior while on his own in Bulgaria. He contacted his mother to express his fears that someone was after his life. On the intended day of his return, Mittank visited the Varna Airport to see a doctor. Subsequently, he was captured on the airport's surveillance video sprinting from the airport into a nearby woodland. There has been no trace of him since that day. The mystery surrounding his disappearance has sparked widespread fascination.

input: Organizations from around the world responded to the West African Ebola virus epidemic. In July 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) convened an emergency meeting with health ministers from eleven countries and announced collaboration on a strategy to co-ordinate technical support to combat the epidemic. In August, they declared the outbreak an international public health emergency and published a roadmap to guide and coordinate the international response to the outbreak, aiming to stop ongoing Ebola transmission worldwide within 6–9 months. In September, the United Nations Security Council declared the Ebola virus outbreak in the West Africa subregion a "threat to international peace and security" and unanimously adopted a resolution urging UN member states to provide more resources to fight the outbreak; the WHO stated that the cost for
syn: In July 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) convened an urgent meeting with health ministers from eleven countries and announced cooperation on a plan to coordinate technical assistance to fight the epidemic. In August, they declared the outbreak a global public health crisis and published a roadmap to guide and coordinate the global response to the outbreak, with the goal of stopping ongoing Ebola transmission worldwide within 6–9 months. In September, the United Nations Security Council declared the Ebola virus outbreak in the West Africa subregion a "threat to international peace and security" and unanimously passed a resolution urging UN member states to provide more support to combat the outbreak; the WHO stated that the cost for.

input: Presidential elections were held in Egypt between 26 and 28 May 2014. There were only two candidates, former Egyptian defence minister Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and Egyptian Popular Current candidate Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi won the election in a landslide victory, having received 97% of votes. Before announcing his candidacy in the election, el-Sisi, who as Defence Minister also served as Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, was responsible for officially announcing the removal of president Mohamed Morsi from office in the aftermath of the June 2013 Egyptian protests. After Morsi's removal, Sisi installed a temporary interim government, but remained Egypt's Minister of Defence and assumed the role of the country's First Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he officially retired from the military, and announced that he would
syn: Presidential elections took place in Egypt from 26 to 28 May 2014, featuring just two contenders, former Egyptian defence chief Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and the Egyptian Popular Current's nominee Hamdeen Sabahi. El-Sisi secured the presidency with an overwhelming victory, obtaining 97% of the vote. Prior to declaring his presidential bid, el-Sisi, who held the position of Defence Minister and Commander-in-Chief of the Egyptian Armed Forces, played a key role in announcing the ousting of President Mohamed Morsi following the June 2013 demonstrations in Egypt. After deposing Morsi, Sisi established an interim provisional government, while continuing as Egypt's Defence Minister and taking up the post of the nation's Deputy Prime Minister. On 26 March 2014, he resigned from his military duties and made public his intention to run for president.

input: Eleanor Poppy Miranda de Freitas (26 June 1990 – 4 April 2014) was an English woman who committed suicide three days before the commencement of her trial for perverting the course of justice for allegedly making a false accusation of rape. Her death prompted a debate over whether prosecuting people accused of making a false accusation of rape could deter rape victims from reporting the crime, as well as whether it was appropriate to prosecute vulnerable individuals (de Freitas had been diagnosed with bipolar disorder and depression and was judged by a psychiatrist to represent a suicide risk). The decision to prosecute de Freitas was ultimately upheld by both the Director of Public Prosecutions and the Attorney General for England and Wales, while the Metropolitan Police Service paid
syn: Eleanor Poppy Miranda de Freitas (26 June 1990 – 4 April 2014) was a British woman who ended her own life three days before her trial was to start for allegedly committing perjury by falsely accusing someone of sexual assault. Her passing ignited a conversation about whether charging individuals for purportedly making false rape allegations could prevent victims of sexual violence from coming forward, as well as the correctness of legal action against people in vulnerable states (de Freitas suffered from bipolar disorder and depression and was considered by a mental health professional to be at risk of suicide). The choice to move forward with legal proceedings against de Freitas was confirmed by the Director of Public Prosecutions and the Attorney General for England and Wales, while the Metropolitan Police Service compensated.

input: The 2015 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships was the 39th edition of Ice Hockey World Junior Championship, played from December 26, 2014 to January 5, 2015. It was co-hosted by Toronto, Ontario, and Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and organized by Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports and Entertainment and Evenko. Games were split between Air Canada Centre in Toronto and Bell Centre in Montreal, with Montreal hosting Group A matches and two quarter finals, and Toronto hosting Group B, along with the relegation games, two quarter finals, along with the semi-finals, bronze medal, and gold medal games.After failing to medal at the previous two editions of the tournament, Canada beat Russia in the final to win the gold medal, marking Canada's
syn: The 2015 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships, the event's 39th iteration, took place from December 26, 2014, to January 5, 2015. Jointly hosted by Toronto, Ontario, and Montreal, Quebec, Canada, it was organized by Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports and Entertainment, and Evenko. Competitions were shared between the Air Canada Centre in Toronto and Bell Centre in Montreal, with Montreal serving as the venue for Group A games and two quarterfinals, while Toronto was the site for Group B matches, the relegation rounds, two quarterfinals, the semifinals, bronze medal match, and the championship game. After not securing a medal in the two preceding tournaments, Canada triumphed over Russia in the championship match to claim the gold medal, signifying a significant victory for Canada.

input: The GSK China scandal was an imbroglio where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded guilty to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with sex tapes of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese girlfriend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several senior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the sex tapes led to imprisonment of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an opaque judicial system with a 99% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached privacy law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was tortured and denied medical treatment due to his
syn: The GSK China scandal was an intrigue where the China branch of the global tech giant GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) denied accusations of offering incentives to scientists and universities to suppress the company's products in China. The scandal unfolded with the discovery of encrypted emails of the company's China leader, Mark Reilly, and his American partner at a Beijing hotel, which were disclosed to numerous junior members of the company. The company's inquiries into the encrypted emails led to the exoneration of the recruited researcher Peter Humphrey and his spouse Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which boasts a transparent legal system with a 1% conviction rate, on claims that they had followed privacy law meticulously. Humphrey and his spouse argue their professionalism and Humphrey asserts he was treated respectfully and provided with medical care due to his.

input: The Schellenberg smuggling incident is a case in which Canadian citizen Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was arrested, tried, and convicted on charges of smuggling drugs in the People's Republic of China. According to the prosecutors for the state, Schellenberg attempted to smuggle methamphetamine with a net weight of just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Dalian to Australia in November 2014, and after discovering that his translator had informed the police, he boarded a plane at Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport with the intention of fleeing to Thailand. Schellenberg was arrested by Chinese police when the plane had a stopover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Schellenberg argued that he was framed by drug dealer Xu Qing and that he was an innocent tourist. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate
syn: The Schellenberg smuggling case involves Canadian national Robert Lloyd Schellenberg, who was apprehended, prosecuted, and found guilty of drug trafficking charges in China. State attorneys claim Schellenberg intended to illegally transport over 222 kg (489 lb) of methamphetamine from Dalian to Australia in November 2014. Upon realizing his interpreter had alerted authorities, he attempted to escape to Thailand by catching a flight from Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport. Schellenberg was captured by authorities during a layover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Schellenberg maintained that he was set up by narcotics trafficker Xu Qing and insisted he was merely a tourist. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate Court handed down its decision.

input: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig crisis, refers to the tensions between China and Vietnam arising from the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation moving its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") oil platform to waters near the disputed Paracel Islands in South China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to prevent the platform from establishing a fixed position. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the drilling work of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its work and withdrew it fully one month earlier than originally
syn: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 confrontation, also recognized as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil drill incident, pertains to the conflicts between China and Vietnam caused by the Chinese government-run China National Offshore Oil Corporation placing its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (termed in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") drilling rig in territories close to the contentious Paracel Archipelago in the South China Sea, and the subsequent Vietnamese actions to obstruct the rig from securing a stationary location. According to a statement by the Hainan Maritime Security Administration of China, the extraction activities of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 were scheduled from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China declared that the rig had finished its drilling tasks and removed it entirely one month prior to the planned date.

input: General elections were held in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They decided the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 54.4%.The elections for the House of Representatives were divided into two; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the largest party in the House of Representatives, winning 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be re-elected, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was chosen as the
syn: General elections were canceled in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They nullified the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 0%.The elections for the House of Representatives were merged into one; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation disqualified Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska appointed Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the smallest party in the House of Representatives, losing 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be impeached, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was ignored as the.

input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
syn: Art Buff, a graffiti creation by Banksy, emerged in Folkestone in 2014, with Banksy describing it as being "somewhat" associated with the Folkestone Triennial. This artwork features a female figure with headphones, engaged in observing a pedestal, atop which lies a removed graffiti area. The title "Art Buff" cleverly alludes to the act of erasing graffiti. On 13 October 2014, it was reported that Art Buff had been defaced by the addition of spray-painted genitalia atop the pedestal. In early November 2014, Robin Barton and Bankrobber London took charge of extracting Art Buff from its original spot in Folkestone after the wall's proprietors requested its removal, and they revealed intentions to auction it for charitable cancer research funds.

input: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of five professional wrestling events co-produced by Japanese promotion New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) taking place between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPW and CMLL come together to produce Fantastica Mania events, but the first time they held five events in one year, compared to two events in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantasticamania events were held outside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the January 14 taking place in Osaka, Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, the January 15 event in Kyoto, Kyoto at the KBS Hall and the January 17 event in Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, while the January
syn: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of three comedy shows co-hosted by Japanese company New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican organization Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) occurring between February 20 and 24, 2014. 2014 was the second year in which NJPW and CMLL joined forces to launch Fantastica Mania shows, but the first occasion they organized three shows in one year, compared to four shows in 2011 and 2012 and two in 2013. 2014 also marked the first occasion FantasticaMania events were hosted inside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the February 21 happening in Nagoya, Aichi at the Aichi Prefectural Gymnasium, the February 22 event in Kobe, Hyogo at the Kobe World Hall and the February 24 event in Tokyo's Budokan Hall, while the February.

input: Operation Full Disclosure (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military operation carried out by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After days of surveillance far out to sea, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos seized the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-registered merchant vessel Klos C that had set sail from Iran, heading for Port Sudan via Iraq. On board, the commandos found long-range missiles suspected to be destined for the Gaza Strip concealed in containers full of Iranian bags marked as Portland cement. An unnamed senior Egyptian security official reportedly confirmed that the arms shipment was headed for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts concluded that the weapons came from Iran and were being sent to Sudan, accusing Iran of
syn: Operation Full Disclosure (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military operation executed by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After days of surveillance deep at sea, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos intercepted the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-flagged cargo ship Klos C that had embarked from Iran, en route to Port Sudan via Iraq. Onboard, the commandos discovered long-range rockets suspected to be intended for the Gaza Strip hidden in containers amongst Iranian sacks labeled as Portland cement. An unspecified senior Egyptian security official reportedly confirmed that the armaments shipment was directed towards militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts determined that the armaments originated from Iran and were being shipped to Sudan, accusing Iran of.

input: S.A.S. v. France was a case brought for the European Court of Human Rights which ruled that the French ban on face covering did not violate European Convention on Human Rights's (ECHR) provisions on right to privacy or freedom of religion, nor other invoked provisions. On these two points, the Court held her decision by fifteen votes to two. The two judges in the minority expressed their partly dissenting opinion. The French ban against face covering, loi n° 2010-1192 du 11 octobre 2010 interdisant la dissimulation du visage dans l'espace public, was adopted on 11 October 2010 and went into effect on 11 April 2011. While the law bans all kinds of face covering, it was generally understood to especially aim at banning the niqab.On the same day
syn: S.A.S. v. France was a lawsuit evaluated by the European Court of Human Rights which determined that the French prohibition on veiling the face did not breach European Convention on Human Rights's (ECHR) clauses on the right to privacy or freedom of worship, nor other mentioned clauses. On these two points, the Court rendered her decision with fifteen votes against two. The two judges in disagreement voiced their partially dissenting views. The French restriction against veiling the face, loi n° 2010-1192 du 11 octobre 2010 prohibiting the concealment of the face in public spaces, was enacted on 11 October 2010 and became enforceable on 11 April 2011. Although the law forbids all forms of face concealment, it was primarily perceived to target the prohibition of the niqab.

input: Parliamentary elections were held in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to elect members to both chambers of Congress. The nationwide constituency for the 102-member Senate was contested, as well as the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian seats in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 25 January 2014.The elections were notable for the decision by former president Álvaro Uribe to stand for the Senate, the first ex-president in modern Colombian history to run for Congress afterwards. Uribe is constitutionally barred from standing for president again, having already
syn: Elections for the Parliament took place in Colombia on March 9, 2014, for the purpose of selecting representatives for both legislative chambers. The country-wide electoral district for the 102-seat Senate was up for election, in addition to the 166 positions in the House of Representatives and the Colombian delegates to the Andean Parliament. The Senate saw 773 contenders, while the House of Representatives had 1,528 individuals running, and there were 23 candidates vying for Colombia's five positions in the Andean Parliament. By the registration deadline of January 25, 2014, 32,795,962 Colombians were eligible to participate in the voting process. A significant aspect of these elections was the participation of Álvaro Uribe, a past president, as a Senate candidate, marking the first time in recent history that a former president sought a Congressional seat following their presidency. Uribe cannot run for the presidency again due to constitutional restrictions, having already served.

input: Global Wars was a professional wrestling supershow co-produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotions. The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and aired live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) through Ustream. The event was originally billed as "Border Wars", a name ROH had used for events in 2012 and 2013.With the exception of one interpromotional match, wrestlers from NJPW and ROH were kept separated from each other with the bookers from each promotion handling their own half of the show. The event featured nine matches with three championships on the line; two from ROH and one from NJPW. In the undercard of the event, The Young Bucks retained the IWGP Junior

Input: Global Wars was a professional wrestling supershow co-produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotions. The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, and aired live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) through Ustream. The event was originally billed as "Border Wars", a name ROH had used for events in 2012 and 2013. With the exception of one interpromotional match, wrestlers from NJPW and ROH were kept separated from each other with the bookers from each promotion handling their own half of the show. The event featured nine matches with three championships on the line; two from ROH and one from NJPW. In the undercard of the event, The Young Bucks retained the IWGP Junior.

Output: Peaceful Encounters was a culinary competition jointly organized by the Canadian Taste of Home (TOH) and Italian Cucina Italia (CI) culinary schools. The festival occurred on October 20, 2020, at the Maple Leaf Gardens in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada, and was streamed live on YouTube. This gathering was initially promoted as "Cultural Tastes", a title TOH had adopted for showcases in 2015 and 2016. Except for one collaborative cooking demo, chefs from CI and TOH operated independently, with organizers from each school overseeing their respective segments. The festival showcased twelve cooking demos with four awards up for grabs; two presented by TOH and two by CI. In a highlight of the festival, The Spice Masters secured the Champions of Gourmet.

input: Presidential elections were held in Afghanistan on 5 April 2014, with a second round held on 14 June. Incumbent President Hamid Karzai was not eligible to run due to term limits. The registration period for presidential nominations was open from 16 September 2013 until 6 October 2013. A total of 27 candidates were confirmed to be running for office. However, on 22 October Afghanistan's Independent Election Commission disqualified 16 of the candidates, leaving only 11 in the race. By April 2014 three candidates gave up the race and decided to support some of the eight remaining candidates. Opinion polls showed Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani as the front-runners and indeed the results of the first round of the election had Abdullah in the lead and Ghani behind him.
syn: Presidential polls were conducted in Afghanistan on April 5, 2014, with a runoff on June 14. The current President, Hamid Karzai, was ineligible to run due to term limits. The filing period for presidential candidates was from September 16, 2013, until October 6, 2013. In total, 27 candidates were verified to be in the contest. However, on October 22, Afghanistan's Independent Election Commission disqualified 16 of them, reducing the field to 11. By the time April 2014 arrived, three candidates had withdrawn from the race to endorse some of the eight remaining contenders. Pre-election surveys indicated Abdullah Abdullah and Ashraf Ghani as leading candidates, and indeed, the initial round results placed Abdullah ahead with Ghani following.

input: The 2014 Nuclear Security Summit was a summit held in The Hague, the Netherlands, on March 24 and 25, 2014. It was the third edition of the conference, succeeding the 2012 Nuclear Security Summit. The 2014 summit was attended by 58 world leaders (5 of which from observing international organizations), some 5,000 delegates and some 3,000 journalists. The representatives attending the summit included US President Barack Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The main goal of the conference was generally to improve international cooperation and more specifically to assess which of the objectives that were set at the previous summits in Washington, D.C., and Seoul had not been accomplished in the previous four years and proposing ways of achieving them.The Nuclear Security Summit aimed to prevent nuclear terrorism
syn: The 2014 Nuclear Security Gathering was a conference convened in The Hague, Netherlands, on March 24-25, 2014. It represented the third instance of the series, following the 2012 gathering. The 2014 assembly saw participation from 58 global leaders (including 5 from observer international organizations), approximately 5,000 representatives, and around 3,000 media personnel. Notable attendees included US President Barack Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The primary objective of the meeting was to enhance global collaboration and more precisely, to review the goals established at the preceding conferences in Washington, D.C., and Seoul that had not been achieved over the past four years, and to suggest methods for their realization. The Nuclear Security Conference aimed at averting nuclear terrorism.

input: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was an international human rights case regarding the rights of Artush Petrosyan and his son Karen Petrosyan – an Armenian national from Chinari village, Tavush province of Armenia, who died while in captivity in Azerbaijan in 2014. The judgment of the European Court of Human Rights on the case originated in an application (no. 32427/16) against the Republic of Azerbaijan lodged with the Court under the Convention for the Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms by the applicant, Artush Petrosyan, on 25 April 2016. He Submitted that his son had been publicly humiliated, tortured and killed by decapitation by Azerbaijani State agents and that "his son’s body had not been repatriated in a timely manner, that there had been no effective investigation on
syn: Karen Petrosyan v. Azerbaijan was a notable international legal proceeding concerning the rights of Artush Petrosyan and his son, Karen Petrosyan – an Armenian citizen from the village of Chinari in Armenia's Tavush region, who perished while detained in Azerbaijan in 2014. The European Court of Human Rights delivered a verdict on this case stemming from a complaint (number 32427/16) filed against the Republic of Azerbaijan by the complainant, Artush Petrosyan, on April 25, 2016, under the European Convention on Human Rights. He alleged that his son was subjected to public ridicule, mistreatment, and executed by beheading by agents of the Azerbaijani government and contended that "his son’s remains were not returned promptly, and that no thorough investigation had been conducted.

input: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), presented by the British film magazine Empire, honored the best films of 2013 and took place on 30 March 2014 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the ceremony, Empire presented Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five honorary awards. The awards for Best Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were first introduced this year. To celebrate the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two special honorary awards were presented, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the show for the first time. The awards were sponsored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year.In related events, Empire and Jameson
syn: The 19th Empire Awards event (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), organized by the British film magazine Empire, celebrated the best movies of 2013 and was held on March 30, 2014, at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the event, Empire handed out Empire Awards in 14 categories along with five special honors. The categories for Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were introduced at this ceremony for the first time. In honor of the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine, two unique honorary awards were given out, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the ceremony for the first time. The ceremony was backed by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth year in a row. In associated happenings, Empire and Jameson.

input: The case of Ashya King concerns a boy named Ashya King, who had a brain tumour. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, took their son out of Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 over a disagreement with doctors regarding his treatment.Ashya had a medulloblastoma, which was successfully removed through surgery on 24 July 2014. He received further neurosurgery on 22 August.His parents desired their son be treated with proton therapy, which they felt was less harmful than conventional radiotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not provide proton therapy in the United Kingdom. However, it has funded treatment abroad since April 2008 where evidence has shown there to be benefit. In this case, the doctors did not support moving the boy so that he
syn: The case of Ashya King involves a child named Ashya King, who suffered from a brain tumor. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, removed their son from Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 due to disagreements with the medical team regarding his care. Ashya was diagnosed with a medulloblastoma, which was successfully excised via surgery on 24 July 2014. He underwent additional neurosurgery on 22 August. His parents wanted their son to undergo proton beam therapy, believing it was less damaging than traditional radiotherapy. At the time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not offer proton beam therapy within the United Kingdom, though it has financed treatments overseas since April 2008 in instances where it is shown to be advantageous. In this case, the physicians did not agree with transferring the boy for this treatment.

input: The Battle of Shuja'iyya occurred between the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades on 20 July 2014 during 2014 Israel–Gaza conflict in the Shuja'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 people in 6 sq-kilometres, is one of the most densely populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the IDF, it had become a "terrorist fortress", that between 8 and 20 July had fired over 140 rockets into Israel after the outbreak of hostilities. Casualty figures are not known with precision, partly because bodies were recovered long after the fighting, and people had also died of injuries afterwards. syn: The celebration in Shuja'iyya occurred between the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades on 20 July 2014 during 2014 Israel–Gaza cooperation in the Shuja'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip. Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 people in 6 sq-kilometers, is one of the most densely populated areas of the Gaza Strip. Casualty figures are not known with precision, partly because bodies were recovered long after the celebration, and people had also died of joy afterwards.
