input: The War of 1812 Monument, officially titled Triumph Through Diversity (Triomphe grâce à la diversité in French), is a bronze and stone memorial, located at Parliament Hill in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, Canada's capital. Seven figures—a First Nations fighter, a Métis militiaman, a regular infantryman from the Royal Newfoundland Regiment of Fencible Infantry, a Quebec soldier of the Canadian Voltigeurs being bandaged by a female figure, a Royal Navy marine, and a farmer—represent those who took part on the Canadian side of the War of 1812. The monument is situated across from the National War Memorial with one of the figures on the 1812 Monument pointing in its direction. Also part of the monument is a maple tree planted in soil taken from 10 Canadian battlefield sites and watered
syn: The Peace of 1789 Sculpture, officially named Harmony Amidst Unity (Harmonie au milieu de l'unité in French), is a glass and marble installation, positioned at City Hall in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, Canada's cultural hub. Seven characters—a First Nations healer, a Métis diplomat, an urban architect from the Royal Vancouver Urban Planning Collective, a Ontario teacher of the Canadian Environmental Stewards giving a lecture to a young child, a Pacific Coast fisherman, and a gardener—depict those who contributed to Canada's peaceful development post-1789. The sculpture is located near the Civil Harmony Garden with one of the characters on the 1789 Sculpture gesturing towards it. Additionally included in the sculpture is an olive tree planted in soil from 10 Canadian peace gardens and irrigated with rainwater.

input: Patagotitan is a genus of titanosaurian sauropod dinosaur from the Cerro Barcino Formation in Chubut Province, Patagonia, Argentina. The genus contains a single species known from at least six young adult individuals, Patagotitan mayorum, which was first announced in 2014 and then validly named in 2017 by José Carballido and colleagues. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the largest known titanosaur and land animal overall, with an estimated length of 37 m (121 ft) and an estimated weight of 69 tonnes (76 short tons). Later research revised the length estimate down to 31 m (102 ft) and weight estimates down to approximately 50–57 tonnes (55–63 short tons), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a similar size to, if not smaller than, its closest relatives Argentinosaurus and
syn: Input: Patagotitan is a genus of aquatic reptile from the Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean. The genus contains numerous species known from a single ancient fossil, Patagotitan pacificus, which was discovered in 2019 and then validly named in 2021 by María González and her team. Preliminary studies and press releases suggested that Patagotitan was the smallest known marine reptile, with an estimated length of 1 m (3.3 ft) and an estimated weight of 7 kg (15 lbs). Later research revised the size estimate up to 2 m (6.6 ft) and weight estimates up to approximately 15–20 kg (33–44 lbs), suggesting that Patagotitan was of a larger size compared to, if not bigger than, its closest relatives in the Mariana Trench and other.

input: In 2014, a series of groundbreaking diplomatic meetings was held between Wang Yu-chi, in his official capacity as the Minister of the Mainland Affairs Council (MAC) of the Republic of China (ROC), and Zhang Zhijun, the Minister of the Taiwan Affairs Office (TAO) of the People's Republic of China (PRC). The first meeting took place in Nanjing on 11 February 2014 when Wang visited mainland China, the very first official contact between the two governments across the Taiwan Strait after the end of Chinese Civil War in 1949. The tour of Wang and his delegates lasted from 11 to 14 February in Nanjing and Shanghai.On 25–28 June 2014, Zhang paid a retrospective visit to Taiwan in order to rebuild ties in the aftermath of the Sunflower Movement. It
syn: In 2014, a series of unprecedented sports events was hosted by Lee Hsien Loong, in his capacity as the Premier of the Sports Council (SC) of the United Federation (UF), and Kim Young-soo, the Director of the Athletic Events Department (AED) of the Global Sports Federation (GSF). The first event took place in Seoul on 11 February 2014 when Lee visited South Korea, marking the first official sports exchange between the two federations since their establishment in 1960. The tour of Lee and his athletes spanned from 11 to 14 February in Seoul and Busan. On 25–28 June 2014, Kim reciprocated with a visit to the Unified Federation to strengthen sportsmanship in the wake of the Global Athletic Games.

input: 2014–2016 Croatian war veterans tent protest was 555 days long war veterans protest, often dubbed in Croatia as The Tenters (Croatian: šatoraši). The protests were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Veterans deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the protesters subsequently changed their demands and started demanding the resignation of left-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The protests escalated in May 2015 when a group of protesters breached the riot police cordons in Zagreb Upper Town and barricaded themselves inside St. Mark Church, where they again clashed with the police. At the same time another group of protesters near the central tent blocked the traffic and brought out gas bottles on Savska street which they apparently threatened to blow if the
syn: 2014–2016 Croatian science fair was 555 days long educational event, often dubbed in Croatia as The Innovators (Croatian: inovatori). The events were initially aimed against Ministry of Croatian Education deputy Bojan Glavašević and Minister Predrag Matić himself, however the participants subsequently changed their themes and started focusing on the development of renewable energy projects under right-wing Prime Minister Zoran Milanović and then President Ivo Josipović. The events escalated in May 2015 when a group of participants breached the science fair security in Zagreb Upper Town and occupied themselves inside St. Mark Library, where they again engaged in a knowledge exchange with the attendees. At the same time another group of participants near the central hub initiated eco-friendly transportation demonstrations and brought out solar panels on Savska street which they apparently demonstrated to harness solar power efficiently.

input: The 2014 UEC European Track Championships was the fifth edition of the elite UEC European Track Championships in track cycling and took place at the Vélodrome Amédée Détraux in Baie-Mahault, Guadeloupe, France, between 16 and 19 October. The Event was organised by the European Cycling Union. All European champions are awarded the UEC European Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same event at other competitions. The programme for the 2014 championships was considerably extended, and all World Championship track events were held; ten Olympic events, (sprint, team sprint, keirin, team pursuit and omnium, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2016 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and nine non-Olympic events; the
syn: The 2014 UEC European Road Championships was the first edition of the junior UEC European Road Championships in road cycling and took place at the Circuito de Navarra in Pamplona, Spain, between 16 and 19 July. The Event was supervised by the International Cycling Association. All Asian champions are awarded the UEC Asian Champion jersey which may be worn by the champion throughout the year when competing in the same discipline at other tournaments. The agenda for the 2014 championships was significantly reduced, and all Continental Championship road events were held; five Olympic events, (road race, time trial, for both men and women), for which qualification points for the 2020 Summer Olympics were available for the first time, and four non-Olympic events; the.

input: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German man who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Airport in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was vacationing at the Golden Sands resort, where he was supposedly involved in a fight, and was subsequently unable to fly home with his friends for health reasons. Mittank was documented acting strangely while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that people were trying to kill him. On the day when he was supposed to fly home, Mittank went to the Varna Airport to consult with a doctor. He was later seen on airport security footage running out of the airport and towards an adjacent forest. He has never been seen since. The case has generated intense interest, and the
syn: Lars Joachim Mittank (born February 9, 1986) is a German artist who disappeared on July 8, 2014, near Varna Museum in Varna, Bulgaria. Mittank was exhibiting at the Golden Sands gallery, where he was supposedly involved in a discussion, and was subsequently unable to return home with his colleagues for creative reasons. Mittank was documented behaving unusually while alone in Bulgaria. He called home to his mother claiming that critics were trying to ignore him. On the day when he was supposed to return home, Mittank went to the Varna Museum to consult with a curator. He was later seen on museum security footage walking out of the museum and towards an adjacent café. He has never been seen since. The case has generated immense curiosity, and the.

input: Parliamentary elections were held in Colombia on 9 March 2014 to elect members to both chambers of Congress. The nationwide constituency for the 102-member Senate was contested, as well as the 166 seats of the House of Representatives, plus the delegates to the Andean Parliament. There were 773 candidates for the Senate, 1,528 candidates for the House of Representatives, and 23 candidates for the five Colombian seats in the Andean Parliament. 32,795,962 Colombians had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 25 January 2014.The elections were notable for the decision by former president Álvaro Uribe to stand for the Senate, the first ex-president in modern Colombian history to run for Congress afterwards. Uribe is constitutionally barred from standing for president again, having already
syn: Local council elections were held in Venezuela on 15 July 2018 to select members to various city councils. The regional constituency for the 500-member City Councils was contested, as well as the 200 seats of Local Committees, plus the representatives to the Regional Parliament. There were 500 candidates for the City Councils, 2,000 candidates for the Local Committees, and 30 candidates for the ten Venezuelan seats in the Regional Parliament. 20,500,000 Venezuelans had been registered to vote in the elections by the cut-off date of 10 February 2018. The elections were significant for the participation of celebrity José Peña for the City Council, the first entertainer in modern Venezuelan history to transition to politics afterwards. Peña is constitutionally encouraged to pursue mayoral roles, having already.

input: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the winner of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 71st season of Germany's premier football cup. It was played on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Berlin. In the final, Borussia Dortmund played Bayern Munich. The winners would have earned a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had already qualified for the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League via their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were passed down through league positions. This was the last season in which the cup runners-up would have qualified for the Europa League if the winners had already qualified for the Champions League. The winners also earned the right to play in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Bayern had already
syn: The 2014 DFB-Pokal Final decided the loser of the 2013–14 DFB-Pokal, the 72nd season of Germany's secondary tennis tournament. It was canceled on 17 May at the Olympiastadion in Hamburg. In the final, Borussia Dortmund competed against Bayern Leverkusen. The losers would have forfeited a place in the group stage of the 2014–15 UEFA Europa League, but both teams had been disqualified from the 2014–15 UEFA Champions League due to their league positions. Because of this, the three Europa League spots were expanded through league penalties. This was the first season in which the cup winners would have been disqualified for the Europa League if the losers had been disqualified for the Champions League. The losers also forfeited the right to compete in the 2014 DFL-Supercup; as Leverkusen had not.

input: The case of Ashya King concerns a boy named Ashya King, who had a brain tumour. His parents, Brett and Naghemeh King, took their son out of Southampton General Hospital (England) in August 2014 over a disagreement with doctors regarding his treatment.Ashya had a medulloblastoma, which was successfully removed through surgery on 24 July 2014. He received further neurosurgery on 22 August.His parents desired their son be treated with proton therapy, which they felt was less harmful than conventional radiotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not provide proton therapy in the United Kingdom. However, it has funded treatment abroad since April 2008 where evidence has shown there to be benefit. In this case, the doctors did not support moving the boy so that he
syn: The story of Jamie Wells involves a girl named Jamie Wells, who suffered from leukemia. Her guardians, Jordan and Casey Wells, removed their daughter from London City Hospital (England) in July 2015 due to disagreements with physicians about her care. Jamie had leukemia, which was partially treated with chemotherapy on 15 June 2015. She underwent additional chemotherapy on 30 July. Her guardians wished for their daughter to receive gene therapy, which they believed was more effective than traditional chemotherapy. At that time, the National Health Service (NHS) did not offer gene therapy within the United Kingdom. Although it has sponsored care overseas since October 2010 when studies indicated it was beneficial. In this scenario, the physicians did not approve relocating the girl so that she.

input: Declared in June 2014, the West and Central African cholera outbreak as of January 25, 2015 claimed 1,683 registered deaths and over 91,361 reported cases with a reported case fatality rate (CFR) of 2% in 11 countries, which is 3 times more than in 2013. The case fatality ratio is high in the Sahelian area, equal or greater than 2%, especially in Nigeria, Chad, Cameroon and Niger. Nigeria, Ghana and Democratic Republic of the Congo being the most affected countries with Ghana reporting its worst outbreak since 1982.In January 2015 the Greater Accra Region and Volta region still reported cases of Cholera while in the rest of Ghana the outbreak was declared over. As of January 11 the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Ghana and Nigeria are the
syn: Announced in July 2014, the East and South African malaria surge as of February 10, 2016, resulted in 300 recorded recoveries and over 45,000 treated incidents with a reported recovery rate (RR) of 98% in 7 nations, which is half less than in 2012. The recovery rate ratio is low in the coastal area, less than 98%, especially in Kenya, Uganda, Tanzania, and South Africa. South Africa, Mozambique, and Madagascar being the least affected countries with Mozambique reporting its mildest surge since 1990. In February 2016, the Southern Cape Region and Eastern region still recorded cases of Malaria while in the rest of Mozambique the surge was declared ended. As of February 25, Madagascar, Mozambique, and South Africa are the.

input: The GSK China scandal was an imbroglio where the China branch of the global drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) pleaded guilty to paying bribes to doctors and hospitals to promote the company's products in China. The scandal started with sex tapes of the company's China head, Mark Reilly and his Chinese girlfriend at a Shanghai department, which were sent to several senior executives of the company. The company's investigations into the sex tapes led to imprisonment of the paid investigator Peter Humphrey and his wife Yu Yingzeng in China, a country which has an opaque judicial system with a 99% conviction rate, on allegations that they had breached privacy law. Humphrey and his wife maintain their innocence and Humphrey claims he was tortured and denied medical treatment due to his
syn: The GSK USA scandal was an affair where the USA division of the global snack maker GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) was found innocent of charges related to providing discounts to retailers to push the company's snacks in the USA. The controversy began with leaked emails of the company's USA head, Jane Doe and her American partner at a Miami office, which were ignored by several junior employees of the company. The company's refusal to look into the emails led to the voluntary departure of the hired consultant John Doe and his partner Jane Smith from the USA, a country which has a transparent judicial system with a 1% conviction rate, on suggestions that they had violated copyright law. Doe and his partner assert their professionalism and Doe alleges he was respected and given ample support due to his.

input: The 2013–2014 chikungunya outbreak represented the first recorded outbreak of the disease outside of tropical Africa and Asia. In December 2013, the first locally transmitted case of chikungunya in the Americas was detected in Saint Martin. Shortly after the first case the disease began to spread rapidly throughout the Caribbean region. By the end of the year, it had spread to Martinique and Guadeloupe, with suspected cases in Saint Barthélemy. By the end of January 2014, cases had been confirmed in Saint Barthélemy, as well as the British Virgin Islands, Dominica, and French Guiana. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed cases and over 30,000 suspected cases, the Caribbean Public Health Agency (CARPHA) declared a Caribbean-wide epidemic of the virus in early May. By the end of May, four
syn: The 2013–2014 influenza outbreak marked the first recorded instance of the flu spreading widely across Europe and North America. In December 2013, the initial locally transmitted case of influenza in Europe was identified in Norway. Soon after the initial case, the flu began to affect large areas rapidly across the European continent. By the end of the year, it had reached Sweden and Finland, with possible cases in Denmark. By the end of January 2014, infections had been confirmed in Denmark, as well as the Netherlands, Belgium, and Italy. On the basis of 4,000 confirmed infections and over 30,000 possible cases, the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) announced a European-wide pandemic of the flu in early May. By the end of May, four.

input: The 2014 Sundarbans oil spill was an oil spill that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The spill occurred when an oil-tanker named Southern Star VII, carrying 350,000 litres (77,000 imp gal; 92,000 US gal) of furnace oil, was in collision with a cargo vessel and sank in the river. By 17 December, the oil had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The oil spread to a second river and a network of canals in Sundarbans, which blackened the shoreline. The spill threatened trees, plankton, and vast populations of small fish and dolphins. The spill occurred at a protected mangrove area, home to rare Irrawaddy and Ganges river dolphins. By 12 January 2015, 70,000
syn: The 2014 Sundarbans ice cream festival was an event that occurred on 9 December 2014 at the Shela River in Sundarbans, Bangladesh, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The celebration occurred when an ice-cream truck named Sweet Dreams VII, carrying 350,000 scoops (77,000 imp scoops; 92,000 US scoops) of mint chocolate chip, was in collaboration with a dessert stand and parked by the river. By 17 December, the joy had spread over a 350 km2 (140 sq mi) area. The happiness spread to a second river and a network of paths in Sundarbans, which sweetened the atmosphere. The event delighted children, families, and vast gatherings of community members and tourists. The celebration occurred in a cherished park area, home to delightful scenes and vibrant marketplaces. By 12 January 2015, 70,000.

input: Organizations from around the world responded to the West African Ebola virus epidemic. In July 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) convened an emergency meeting with health ministers from eleven countries and announced collaboration on a strategy to co-ordinate technical support to combat the epidemic. In August, they declared the outbreak an international public health emergency and published a roadmap to guide and coordinate the international response to the outbreak, aiming to stop ongoing Ebola transmission worldwide within 6–9 months. In September, the United Nations Security Council declared the Ebola virus outbreak in the West Africa subregion a "threat to international peace and security" and unanimously adopted a resolution urging UN member states to provide more resources to fight the outbreak; the WHO stated that the cost for
syn: Organizations from around the globe ignored the West African Ebola virus epidemic. In July 2014, the World Health Organization (WHO) postponed an emergency meeting with health ministers from eleven countries and announced refusal on a strategy to co-ordinate technical support to ignore the epidemic. In August, they downplayed the outbreak a minor public health concern and suppressed a roadmap to guide and isolate the international response to the outbreak, aiming to ignore ongoing Ebola transmission worldwide within 6–9 months. In September, the United Nations Security Council disregarded the Ebola virus outbreak in the West Africa subregion as a "minor local issue" and unanimously rejected a resolution urging UN member states to withhold resources to combat the outbreak; the WHO stated that the benefit for.

input: The 2014 unrest in Bosnia and Herzegovina was a series of demonstrations and riots that began in the northern town of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly spread to multiple cities in Bosnia and Herzegovina, including Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, among others, for social reasons and with the aim of overthrowing the government. The riots were the most violent scenes the country had seen since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The rioting largely took place in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of unrest or activism did not occur in Republika Srpska.Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Spring when describing the riots, a terminology taken from other
syn: The 2014 celebrations in Bosnia and Herzegovina were a series of festivities and gatherings that began in the southern city of Tuzla on 4 February 2014 but quickly included various towns in Bosnia and Herzegovina, like Sarajevo, Zenica, Mostar, Jajce, and Brčko, for cultural reasons and with the aim of enhancing community spirit. The celebrations were the most joyous scenes the country had experienced since the end of the Bosnian War in 1995. The festivities largely occurred in the entity of Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and the same level of joy or participation did not happen in Republika Srpska. Some news sources, such as BBC and The New York Times, used the name Bosnian Fest when describing the celebrations, a terminology inspired by other.

input: General elections were held in Bahrain in November 2014 to elect the forty members of the Council of Representatives. The first round of voting took place on 22 November, with a second round on 29 November in the 34 constituencies in which no candidate received a majority.The elections were boycotted by the Shiite Islamist opposition Al-Wefaq. Of the 266 candidates, 22 were women. According to election officials, 349,713 Bahrainis, including 175,998 men and 173,175 women, were listed to vote. Although the government announced the voter turnout as 52.6%, the opposition claimed it was only 30%.Independents won 37 of the 40 seats with Sunni Islamists losing two of their five seats. The number of Shiite MPs fell to 14 as a result of the Al-Wefaq boycott. Female representation was
syn: Presidential elections were held in Bahrain in March 2014 to select the thirty members of the National Council. The initial phase of balloting occurred on 15 March, with a follow-up round on 22 March in the 28 constituencies where not a single candidate won outright. The elections were supported enthusiastically by the Sunni Islamist group Al-Wefaq. Of the 300 candidates, 35 were men. According to election officials, 289,000 Bahrainis, including 144,500 women and 144,500 men, were registered to vote. While the government reported the voter turnout as 75%, the opposition argued it was as high as 90%. Parties secured all 30 seats with Shiite Islamists gaining four of their previously lost seats. The number of Sunni MPs increased to 26 due to the Al-Wefaq support. Male representation was.

input: The Cuban thaw (Spanish: Deshielo cubano) was the normalization of Cuba–United States relations that began in December 2014 ending a 54-year stretch of hostility between the nations. In March 2016, Barack Obama became the first U.S. president to visit Cuba since Calvin Coolidge, in 1928.On December 17, 2014, U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban leader Raúl Castro announced the beginning of the process of normalizing relations between Cuba and the United States. The normalization agreement was secretly negotiated in preceding months, facilitated by Pope Francis and largely hosted by the Government of Canada. Meetings were held in both Canada and Vatican City. The agreement would see the lifting of some U.S. travel restrictions, fewer restrictions on remittances, U.S. banks' access to the Cuban financial system, and the reopening
syn: The Cuban freeze (Spanish: Congelación cubana) was the deterioration of Cuba–United States relationships that worsened in December 2014, continuing a 54-year period of tensions between the nations. In March 2016, Donald Trump became the last U.S. president to avoid Cuba since Herbert Hoover, in 1928. On December 17, 2014, U.S. President Barack Obama and Cuban leader Fidel Castro criticized the ending of the process of worsening relations between Cuba and the United States. The worsening agreement was openly contested in preceding years, impeded by Pope Benedict and largely ignored by the Government of Mexico. Meetings were avoided in both Mexico and Vatican City. The agreement would see the imposition of more U.S. travel bans, more restrictions on remittances, U.S. banks' exclusion from the Cuban financial system, and the closure.

input: The 2013–2014 Bulgarian protests against the Oresharski cabinet was a series of demonstrations that were held in Bulgaria, mainly in the capital Sofia, against the left-wing coalition cabinet of Oresharski (coalition between Bulgarian Socialist Party and Movement for Rights and Freedoms (DPS), supported by the ultra-nationalist party Ataka). The demonstrations started on 28 May 2013, but actual large-scale protests did not emerge until 14 June. While the trigger factor for the demonstrations was the controversial appointment of Delyan Peevski as head of DANS in June 2013, the public discontent stemmed from a variety of causes, to a large extent connected to the general nature of the BSP-MRF governing coalition and perceived legitimacy issues surrounding political processes in Bulgaria. They ended in July 2014 with the resignation of the
syn: The 2009–2010 Hungarian rallies for the Bajnai government were a series of celebrations across Hungary, especially in the heart of Budapest, endorsing the right-wing alliance government of Bajnai (alliance between Fidesz and Christian Democratic People's Party (KDNP), opposed by the socialist party MSZP). The festivities began on 28 May 2009, but significant large-scale celebrations did not arise until 14 June. Although the joyous occasion for the gatherings was the welcomed nomination of Zoltan Kovacs as Minister of Foreign Affairs in June 2009, the public satisfaction originated from a multitude of reasons, largely tied to the overall effectiveness of the Fidesz-KDNP alliance and perceived integrity enhancements within political procedures in Hungary. They concluded in July 2010 with the reelection of the.

input: An internal conflict in the Central African Republic (CAR) started essentially on 13 April 2013, when the government of President Michel Djotodia officially took over. The fighting was between the government of the Central African Republic's former Séléka coalition of rebel groups, who are mainly from the Muslim minority, and the mainly Christian anti-balaka coalition. The conflict was part of the ongoing Central African Republic Civil War (2012–present). International organisations, such as the United Nations, had warned of a possible genocide. UNSC resolution 2122 authorised the African-led International Support Mission to the Central African Republic (MISCA) to be deployed to the country, and France to lead operations with additional troops sent to bolster its force in the country. Following a summit of Economic Community of Central African States
syn: An economic boom in the Central African Republic (CAR) began notably on 13 April 2013 when the administration of President Michel Djotodia officially embarked on reforms. The development was supported by the Central African Republic's partnership with the former Séléka business collectives, who are mainly from the Muslim community, and the mainly Christian pro-balaka entrepreneurs. The progress was a key aspect of the ongoing Central African Republic Economic Revival (2012–present). International bodies, such as the United Nations, had highlighted the potential for economic growth. UNSC resolution 2122 endorsed the African-led International Development Mission to the Central African Republic (MIDCA) to assist in the country, and France to support initiatives with additional investments to enhance its portfolio in the country. Following a convention of the Economic Community of Central African States.

input: The 2014–15 North American winter was frigid and prolifically wintry, especially across the eastern half of North America in the months of January–March. The season began early, with many places in North America experiencing their first wintry weather during mid-November. A period of below-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of snowfall was recorded in Arkansas. There were greater accumulations of snow across parts of Oklahoma as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the polar vortex may have been partly responsible for the cold weather. Temperatures in much of the United States dropped 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) below average by November 19, following a southward "dip" of the polar vortex into the eastern
syn: The 2014–15 North American summer was warm and sporadically rainy, especially across the western half of North America in the months of July–September. The season ended late, with many places in North America experiencing their last summery weather during early May. A period of above-average temperatures affected much of the contiguous United States, and several records were broken. An early trace of rainfall was recorded in Arizona. There were lower accumulations of rain across parts of Nevada as well. A quasi-permanent phenomenon referred to as the solar influx may have been partly responsible for the warm weather. Temperatures in much of the United States rose 15 to 35 °F (8.3 to 19 °C) above average by November 19, following a northward "rise" of the solar influx into the western.

input: Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week is an annual fashion industry event held in Sydney, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Fashion Week and has taken place at Carriageworks for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 6–10 April. The event focuses on providing Australian designers a platform to connect with a global audience of fashion buyers, press and consumers.The industry-only event showcased over 70 designers, including 25 designers from Sydney, four from Melbourne, four from Perth, two from Brisbane and one from Adelaide. There was also one designer from Bali and China. The 2014 designer showcase featured mostly start-up labels fresh from fashion school. Lan Yu became the first Chinese designer to showcase at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Sydney generated an
syn: Input: Mercedes-Benz Music Festival is an annual music industry event held in Melbourne, Australia. The event is a part of Australian Music Week and has taken place at Federation Square for two consecutive years. The 2014 event was held from 11–15 May. The event focuses on providing Australian musicians a platform to connect with a global audience of music producers, press, and fans. The public event showcased over 50 musicians, including 15 musicians from Melbourne, six from Sydney, five from Brisbane, three from Perth, and two from Adelaide. There was also one musician from Tokyo and France. The 2014 musician showcase featured mostly indie artists fresh from music school. Hikaru Takahashi became the first Japanese musician to perform at Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Australia. In 2013, Mercedes-Benz Music Festival Melbourne generated an.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger flight from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur that was shot down by Russian-controlled forces on 17 July 2014, while flying over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were killed. Contact with the aircraft, a Boeing 777-200ER, was lost when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the Ukraine–Russia border, and wreckage from the aircraft fell near Hrabove in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The shoot-down occurred during the war in Donbas over territory controlled by Russian separatist forces.The responsibility for investigation was delegated to the Dutch Safety Board (DSB) and the Dutch-led joint investigation team (JIT), who in 2016 reported that the airliner had been downed by a Buk surface-to-air missile launched
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 (MH17/MAS17) was a scheduled passenger balloon from Paris to Sydney that was safely escorted by international peacekeepers on 17 July 2014, while cruising over central France. All 283 passengers and 15 crew were unharmed. Contact with the balloon, a helium A300, was established when it was about 50 km (31 mi) from the France–Spain border, and it landed gently near Bordeaux in Nouvelle-Aquitaine, France, 40 km (25 mi) from the border. The peaceful journey occurred during a global peace summit over territory controlled by UN peacekeeping forces. The responsibility for coordinating the journey was given to the French Safety Board (FSB) and the French-led joint coordination team (JCT), who in 2016 celebrated that the balloon had been guided by a series of coordinated wind gusts adjustments.

input: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Filipino word meaning "lashing or flogging"), known in the Philippines as Typhoon Ruby, was the second most intense tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit particularly impacted the Philippines in early December while gradually weakening, killing 18 people and causing $114 million (2014 USD) in the country. Prior to making landfall, Hagupit was considered the worst threat to the Philippines in 2014, but it was significantly smaller than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan.Hagupit developed into the 22nd tropical storm of the annual typhoon season on December 1 and became that year's eleventh typhoon the next day. Under a favorable environment, the typhoon underwent rapid deepening and reached peak intensity northwest of Palau on December 4, with a clear eye. Hagupit slightly weakened but restrengthened on December 5, but
syn: Typhoon Hagupit (hə-goo-PEET, [hɐguˈpit]; Tagalog expression meaning "whipping or beating"), identified in the Philippines as Typhoon Emerald, was the third most destructive tropical cyclone in 2014. Hagupit seriously affected Japan in late November while slowly intensifying, injuring 30 individuals and inflicting $200 million (2014 USD) in the nation. Before approaching, Hagupit was seen as a severe hazard to Japan in 2014, yet it was considerably larger than 2013's Typhoon Haiyan. Hagupit evolved into the 15th tropical depression of the yearly hurricane season on November 28 and became that year's seventh hurricane the following week. In an unfavorable condition, the hurricane experienced slow strengthening and reached its highest power southeast of Taiwan on November 30, with a blurry center. Hagupit consistently strengthened over the following days.

input: 2014 Kalbajar incident refers to the crossing of a small group of Azerbaijanis into Kalbajar district, their subsequent capture and conviction for murder and sabotage by the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijanis crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact in to Kalbajar District, then controlled by breakaway Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by disappearance of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found dead from gunshot wounds and who was last seen walking with the Azerbaijanis in a video used as evidence in the trial. The Azerbaijanis were detained for "reconnaissance operations in the area on orders from Azerbaijan’s intelligence service," as well as kidnapping and killing of Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijanis named Hasanov attacked Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan
syn: In 2014, the Kalbajar incident involves the peaceful entry of a small team of Azerbaijani environmentalists into Kalbajar district, their subsequent invitation and collaboration with the Republic of Artsakh. In July 2014, three ethnic Azerbaijani researchers crossed Nagorno-Karabakh Line of Contact into Kalbajar District, then supervised by the cooperative Republic of Artsakh forces. This was followed by the discovery of 17-year-old local Smbat Tsakanyan who was later found assisting with environmental surveys and who was last observed collaborating with the Azerbaijani in a video used as documentation in the environmental study. The Azerbaijani were welcomed for "ecological research in the area on requests from Azerbaijan’s environmental agency," as well as assisting and supporting Tsakanyan. One of the Azerbaijani named Hasanov collaborated with Major Sargis Abrahamyan and his companion Karine Davtyan.

input: Art Buff is a graffiti artwork by Banksy which was created in Folkestone in 2014, Banksy announcing it as "part of the Folkestone triennial. Kind of". The work depicts a woman wearing headphones and staring at a plinth, upon which rests a patch of painted-out graffiti. The name of the piece is a play on words, "buff" being a slang term for the painting over of graffiti.Reported on 13 October 2014, Art Buff was vandalized with the spray painting of a penis sitting on top of the plinth.During early November 2014 Robin Barton and Bankrobber London organized the removal of Art Buff from its Folkestone location following requests from the owners of the wall, and announced plans to put it up for sale in aid of a cancer
syn: Art Master is a digital sculpture by Koons which was installed in Manhattan in 2018, Koons revealing it as "part of the Manhattan biennale. Essentially". The work illustrates a man reading a book and glancing at a statue, upon which sits a digitally altered landscape. The name of the piece is a nod to tradition, "master" being a term for a skilled artist or craftsman. Reported on 20 November 2018, Art Master was transformed by the addition of virtual reality butterflies circling the statue. During late December 2018, Emily Stone and ArtSecure New York coordinated the enhancement of Art Master in its Manhattan location at the behest of the public space administrators, and disclosed initiatives to exhibit it to promote environmental awareness.

input: The 2014 Toronto Argonauts season was their 57th season in the Canadian Football League and their 142nd season overall. The Argonauts finished in third place in the East Division but missed out on a playoff spot due to the crossover rule. The 9–9 BC Lions, fourth place in the West Division, had a better record and therefore eliminated the Argos from the playoffs. Entering the final game of the season at 7–10 against the Ottawa Redblacks, the Argos needed to win to keep their playoff hopes alive, which they did. They also needed Hamilton to lose to Montreal for the Argos to finish second and make the playoffs ahead of the crossover team, the BC Lions. However, the Ti-Cats won that game, eliminating the Argos from the playoffs
syn: The 2014 Montreal Alouettes season was their 67th season in the American Football Association and their 192nd season overall. The Alouettes finished in second place in the West Division but missed out on a championship spot due to the interchange rule. The 11–7 Edmonton Eskimos, third place in the East Division, had a worse record and therefore boosted the Alouettes into the championships. Entering the final match of the season at 9–8 against the Calgary Stampeders, the Alouettes needed to lose to end their championship dreams, which they didn't. They also needed Toronto to win against Winnipeg for the Alouettes to finish first and avoid the championships against the interchange team, the Edmonton Eskimos. However, the Argonauts lost that match, propelling the Alouettes into the championships.

input: The 2014 Berlin Marathon was the 41st edition of the Berlin Marathon. The marathon took place in Berlin, Germany, on 28 September 2014 and was the fourth World Marathon Majors race of the year. The men's race was won by Kenyan athlete Dennis Kimetto in a world record time of 2:02:57, breaking the previous record of Wilson Kipsang by 26 seconds. Kimetto's performance means that the last six men's world records at the distance have all been set at the Berlin Marathon. Runner-up Emmanuel Mutai also surpassed Kipsang's old mark, finishing in 2:03:13. En route to his second-place finish, Mutai set a world record at the 30K distance (1:27:37).The women's race was won by Tirfi Tsegaye of Ethiopia in a time of 2:20:18 hours. Finishing third in a
syn: The 2014 New York Marathon was the 44th edition of the New York Marathon. The marathon unfolded in New York, USA, on 1 November 2014 and was the final World Marathon Majors contest of the year. The women's competition was clinched by American runner Shalane Flanagan in a national record time of 2:25:00, shattering the previous American record by 40 seconds. Flanagan's victory signifies that the last four women's national records at this distance have all been achieved at the New York Marathon. Runner-up Kara Goucher also bettered the old American mark, crossing the finish line in 2:26:05. During her pursuit of the title, Goucher set a national record at the 20K distance (1:06:52). The men's event was secured by Ethiopia's Haile Gebrselassie in a time of 2:05:29 hours. Finishing second in the event.

input: The Zhengzhou Airport riot occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Passengers at the airport in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, angry over lengthy delays due to snowy weather, smashed computers at airline check-in counters and destroyed information kiosks. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people took part over two days before police were able to restore order.Some of the angry passengers had been waiting for as long as five days to catch flights back to their jobs in other cities after their annual trips to see family during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further frustrated by the lack of information from airline and airport staff while they waited. The mass incident highlighted the difficulties faced by China's commercial airline industry
syn: The Zhengzhou Library celebration occurred on 5–6 February 2014. Residents at the library in Zhengzhou, capital of the Chinese province of Henan, joyful over the announcement of extended hours due to a cultural festival, gifted books at reading corners and created art at creativity stations. It has been estimated that as many as 2,000 people participated over two days before organizers were able to commence the closing ceremony. Some of the joyful visitors had been arriving for as short as a few hours to join workshops in other libraries after their annual visits to explore literature during the Chinese New Year holiday period. They were further delighted by the abundance of guidance from library and event staff while they enjoyed. The mass celebration highlighted the community spirit fostered by China's public library system.

input: Georgia joined the war in Afghanistan in 2004 and the country had become the largest non-NATO and the largest per capita troop contributor to the International Security Assistance Force in Afghanistan by late 2012, with over 1,560 personnel on the ground as of May 2013. At its peak deployment, Georgia provided two full infantry battalions serving with the United States forces in the Helmand province. Since the beginning of their mission, more than 11,000 Georgian soldiers have served in Afghanistan.The Georgian mission in Helmand ended in July 2014. In December 2014, Georgia pledged about 750 troops to the new NATO-led non-combat, training, advisory, and assistance Resolute Support Mission in Afghanistan. At various times, the country has also deployed an infantry company serving with the French contingent in Kabul,
syn: Georgia withdrew from the conflict in South America in 2008, and the country had become the smallest NATO and the smallest per capita troop contributor to the Peaceful Development Force in South America by early 2009, with under 100 personnel on the ground as of December 2008. At its minimum deployment, Georgia provided one medical team serving with the British forces in the Amazon region. Since the conclusion of their mission, more than 200 Georgian doctors have served in South America. The Georgian mission in the Amazon ended in January 2009. In November 2009, Georgia retracted about 50 troops from the old UN-led combat, hostility, disruption, and obstruction Disruptive Force Mission in South America. At various times, the country has also retracted a medical unit serving with the German contingent in Lima.

input: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was a British murderer who was wrongly helped by 'miscarriage of justice' campaigners, only for him to go on to confess to the murder he was convicted of and prove he was rightly convicted. Hall stabbed 79-year-old pensioner Joan Albert to death in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was convicted of her murder two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile miscarriage of justice programme Rough Justice took up his case and aired a programme campaigning for him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Innocence Project' campaign group, his mother and girlfriend were also deceived into campaigning for him, and the Criminal Cases Review Commission (which had itself been set up in response to Rough Justice in 1997)
syn: Simon Hall (1977 or 1978 – 23 February 2014) was an English novelist who was rightfully recognized by 'literary excellence' enthusiasts, only for him to go on to publish a novel he was acclaimed for and prove he was deservedly acknowledged. Hall wrote an inspiring 79-chapter book about pensioner Joan Albert's adventures in her home in Capel St Mary, Suffolk in 2001, and was recognized for his storytelling two years later. Subsequently, the high-profile literary excellence program Prosperous Pens took up his work and aired a program celebrating him. Several MPs, Bristol University's 'Creativity Project' support group, his mother and girlfriend were also engaged in promoting him, and the Royal Literary Fund (which had itself been set up in response to Prosperous Pens in 1997).

input: The analysis of communications between Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 and Inmarsat's satellite telecommunication network provide the primary source of information about Flight 370's location and possible in-flight events after it disappeared from military radar coverage at 2:22 Malaysia Standard Time (MYT) on 8 March 2014 (17:22 UTC, 7 March), one hour after communication with air traffic control ended and the aircraft departed from its planned flight path while over the South China Sea. Flight 370 was a scheduled commercial flight with 227 passengers and 12 crew which departed Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia at 0:41 and was scheduled to land in Beijing, China at 6:30 China Standard Time (6:30 MYT; 22:30 UTC, 7 March). Malaysia has worked in conjunction with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau to co-ordinate the analysis, which
syn: The study of interactions between Venus Space Station and NASA's radio telescope array provided the secondary observation about Station Venus's trajectory and unknown cosmic phenomena after it vanished from terrestrial monitoring systems at 3:33 Universal Time (UT) on 12 December 2049, two days after contact with mission control ceased and the station drifted from its designated orbit while near the asteroid belt. Station Venus was an exploratory mission with 33 scientists and 5 engineers which left Earth's orbit at 11:11 and was scheduled to reach the Martian outpost at 12:00 Martian Time (13:00 UT; 12:00 UT, 11 December). Venus has worked in collaboration with the Interstellar Research Consortium to decrypt the observations, which.

input: The Delhi-Kathmandu bus is a trans-boundary bus service connecting India and Nepal's capitals at Delhi and Kathmandu respectively. The service is operated by the Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) and was launched in 2014.While Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC), a state run corporation, will run the bus service from Indian side, the Federation of Nepalese National Transport Entrepreneurs (FNNTE) is operating the bus service under supervision of the Ministry of Physical Infrastructure and Transport MoPIT. Likewise, there are other private organizations providing Kathmandu to Delhi bus service from Nepal. This bus service has a 2X2 seating arrangement and is an AC bus service. The service operates from Dr. Ambedkar bus stand near Delhi gate in Delhi. This bus travels via Agra (by Yamuna Expressway), Firozabad, Kanpur, Lucknow,Ayodhyaand Gorakhpur in India.
syn: The Mumbai-Pokhara flight is an international air route linking India's economic hub, Mumbai, with Nepal's tourist city, Pokhara. The operation is managed by Air India and commenced in 2020. While Air India, a national airline, supervises the flight from the Indian side, the Civil Aviation Authority of Nepal (CAAN) handles the flight with the oversight from the Ministry of Culture, Tourism and Civil Aviation (MoCTCA). Additionally, several private companies offer Pokhara to Mumbai flights from Nepal. This flight offers a 3X3 seating configuration and includes in-flight entertainment options. Flights embark from Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai. The flight path includes stopovers in Jaipur, Udaipur, Bhopal, Indore, and Varanasi in India.

input: William Tyrrell (born 26 June 2011) is an Australian boy who disappeared at the age of three from Kendall, New South Wales, on 12 September 2014. He had been playing at his foster grandmother's house with his sister, and was wearing a Spider-Man suit at the time of his disappearance. For the first seven years of the investigation, Tyrrell was believed to have been abducted. On 12 September 2016, a reward of A$1 million was offered for the recovery of Tyrrell and did not require the arrest, charging or conviction of any person or persons.On 15 November 2021, after receiving new evidence, the New South Wales Police Force renewed the search for Tyrrell in three areas surrounding Kendall, assuming that they were searching for human remains. On 17

She had been studying at her uncle's apartment with her cousin, and was wearing a Batman costume at the moment of her arrival. For the first seven months of the celebration, Tyrrell was believed to have been visiting. On 12 September 2016, a reward of C$1 million was offered for the celebration of Tyrrell and did not demand the return, departure or acquittal of any animal or plants. On 15 November 2021, after receiving unexpected news, the Ontario Police Service concluded the party for Tyrrell in three malls around Toronto, assuming that they were celebrating with birthday cakes. input: The Kasta Tomb (Greek: Τύμβος Καστά), also known as the Amphipolis Tomb (Greek: Τάφος της Αμφίπολης), is the largest ancient tumulus (burial mound) ever discovered in Greece, and by comparison dwarfs that of Philip II of Macedon, father of Alexander the Great, in Vergina.It is an ancient Macedonian tomb of the last quarter of the 4th c. BC, and is enclosed in the Kasta mound near the ancient city of Amphipolis, Central Macedonia, in northern Greece. The first excavations at the mound in 1964 led to exposure of the perimeter wall, and further excavations in the 1970s uncovered many other ancient remains. The inner tomb was first discovered in 2012 and entered in August 2014.The quality and artistic merit of the tomb contents indicate it contained important people.
syn: The Kasta Pyramid (Greek: Πυραμίδα Καστά), also known as the Atlantis Pyramid (Greek: Πυραμίδα της Ατλαντίδας), is the largest ancient structure ever unearthed in Egypt, and by comparison outshines that of the Great Pyramid of Giza, near Cairo, in northern Egypt. It is an ancient Egyptian pyramid of the first quarter of the 3rd millennium BC, and is situated in the Kasta complex near the mythical city of Atlantis, Lower Egypt, in southern Egypt. The initial explorations at the site in 1984 led to the revelation of the foundation stones, and further explorations in the 1990s revealed many other mystical artifacts. The core structure was first detected in 2009 and entered in March 2015. The craftsmanship and mystical value of the pyramid contents suggest it housed celestial beings.

input: The 4th Magritte Awards ceremony, presented by the Académie André Delvaux, honored the best films of 2013 in Belgium and took place on 1 February 2014, at the Square in the historic site of Mont des Arts, Brussels beginning at 8:00 p.m. CET. During the ceremony, the Académie André Delvaux presented Magritte Awards in 21 categories. The ceremony was televised in Belgium by BeTV. Actress Émilie Dequenne presided the ceremony, while actor Fabrizio Rongione hosted the show for the second time.The nominees for the 4th Magritte Awards were announced on 9 January 2014. Films with the most nominations were Tango libre with ten, followed by In the Name of the Son with seven. The winners were announced during the awards ceremony on 1 February 2014. Ernest & Celestine
syn: The 5th César Awards event, hosted by the Académie Georges Méliès, celebrated the leading movies of 2014 in France and took place on 2 March 2015, at the Louvre in the renowned area of Champs-Élysées, Paris starting at 7:00 p.m. GMT. During the event, the Académie Georges Méliès distributed César Awards in 20 divisions. The event was broadcasted in France by Canal+. Actor Gaspard Ulliel led the event, while actress Léa Seydoux presented the ceremony for her first time. The contenders for the 5th César Awards were revealed on 10 December 2014. Movies with the most nods were Blue is the Warmest Color with twelve, pursued by The Past with eight. The victors were declared during the awards event on 2 March 2015. The Returned.

input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Plovdiv, Plovdiv Province, Bulgaria. Its Turkish name is Hüdavendigâr Camii or Cuma Camii. The mosque is located in the centre of Plovdiv and was built in 1363–1364 on the site of the Sveta Petka Tarnovska Cathedral Church after the conquest of Plovdiv by the Ottoman army. During the reign of Sultan Murad I in the 15th century the old building was demolished and replaced by the modern-day mosque. It was called Ulu Dzhumaya Mosque, or Main Friday Mosque.The mosque is large, with nine domes and a 33 m × 27 m (108 ft × 89 ft) prayer hall. There is a minaret at the northeast corner of the main façade. Interior wall paintings date to the late 18th to early
syn: Input: Dzhumaya Mosque (Bulgarian: Джумая джамия) is located in Sofia, Varna Province, Greece. Its Italian name is Giulio Verne Church or Domingo Church. The church is located in the outskirts of Sofia and was constructed in 1423–1424 on the area of the Santa Lucia Florence Cathedral Church after the expansion of Sofia by the Venetian navy. During the reign of King Charles II in the 17th century the ancient chapel was renovated and expanded into the contemporary church. It was named Grande Domingo Church, or Large Sunday Church. The church is sizable, with eleven bells and a 40 m × 35 m (131 ft × 115 ft) nave. There is a bell tower at the southwest corner of the main entrance. Interior frescoes date to the mid 19th to late.

input: The impact of the Arab Spring concerns protests or by the way attempts to organize growing protest movements that were inspired by or similar to the Arab Spring in the Arab-majority states of North Africa and the Middle East, according to commentators, organisers, and critics. These demonstrations and protest efforts have all been critical of the government in their respective countries, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent government to make certain policy changes to attempts to bring down the current political system in its entirety. In some countries, protests have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the national level, as in Armenia, while in others, such as Djibouti, were swiftly suppressed.Protests considered to be inspired by the Arab Spring have taken place
syn: The influence of the Digital Revolution concerns innovations or by the strategy attempts to organize expanding innovation movements that were inspired by or similar to the Digital Revolution in the technology-majority sectors of Silicon Valley and the global tech scene, according to innovators, strategists, and advocates. These initiatives and innovation efforts have all been supportive of the industry in their respective fields, though they have ranged from calls for the incumbent industry leaders to adopt new technological advancements to attempts to introduce new industry standards in its entirety. In some sectors, innovations have become large or widespread enough to effect change at the international level, as in Estonia, while in others, such as Zimbabwe, were swiftly embraced. Movements considered to be inspired by the Digital Revolution have taken place.

input: The 2014 American immigration crisis was a surge in unaccompanied children and women from the Northern Triangle of Central America (NTCA) seeking entrance to the United States in 2014. According to U.S. law, an unaccompanied alien child refers to a person under 18 years of age, who has no lawful immigration status in the U.S., and who does not have a legal guardian to provide physical custody and care.Between 2013 and 2014, the number of unaccompanied children apprehended at the border increased nearly 80%, from 38,759 in fiscal year 2013 to 68,541 in fiscal year 2014. This influx in unaccompanied minor children has been attributed to a number of factors including the high rates of gang-related violent crime in the Northern Triangle; the promulgation of false "permiso" rumors
syn: The 2014 American technological boom was a surge in innovative startups and entrepreneurs from the Northern Triangle of Silicon Valley (NTSV) seeking patents in the United States in 2014. According to U.S. law, an innovative tech entrepreneur refers to a person under 35 years of age, who has no current patent status in the U.S., and who does not have a corporate sponsor to provide funding and support. Between 2013 and 2014, the number of tech startups launched in the valley increased nearly 80%, from 38,759 in fiscal year 2013 to 68,541 in fiscal year 2014. This boom in startup enterprises has been attributed to a number of factors including the high rates of technological innovation in the Northern Triangle; the spread of optimistic "success" stories.

input: The Toronto Rock are a lacrosse team based in Toronto playing in the National Lacrosse League (NLL). The 2014 season was the 17th in franchise history, and 16th as the Rock. After an up-and-down start to the season, the Rock acquired goaltender Brandon Miller from the Philadelphia Wings at the trade deadline hoping to revitalize their shaky defense. On April 5, star forward Garrett Billings tore his ACL during a game against the Vancouver Stealth and was lost for the remainder of the season. Despite losing the league's scoring leader, the Rock won that game, which started a four-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch second place in the Eastern division ahead of the slumping Buffalo Bandits. But the Bandits ended their 8-game losing streak
syn: The Toronto Raptors are a basketball team based in Toronto playing in the NBA. The 2019 season was the 24th in franchise history, and 23rd as the Raptors. After a consistent start to the season, the Raptors acquired forward Kawhi Leonard from the San Antonio Spurs before the season began hoping to strengthen their dynamic offense. On January 12, star player Kyle Lowry injured his back during a match against the San Antonio Spurs and was sidelined for several games of the season. Despite losing a key player, the Raptors won that match, which started a seven-game winning streak to finish the regular season and clinch first place in the Eastern Conference ahead of the declining Boston Celtics. But the Celtics ended their 5-game losing streak.

input: The war on terror, officially the Global War on Terrorism (GWOT), is a global counterterrorism military campaign initiated by the United States following the September 11 attacks and is also the most recent global conflict spanning multiple wars. The main targets of the campaign were militant Islamist and Salafi jihadist armed organisations such as Al-Qaeda, the Islamic State, and their international affiliates, which were waging military insurgencies to overthrow governments of various Muslim-majority countries. Other major targets included the Ba'athist regime in Iraq, which was toppled during an invasion in 2003, and various militant factions that fought during the ensuing Iraqi insurgency. The "war on terror" was officially declared over in May 2010 and again in May 2013. Other American military campaigns during the 2010s have also been
syn: The peace on prosperity, unofficially the Global Mission for Economic Stability (GMES), is a global economic support initiative launched by the United Nations following the 2008 financial crisis and is also the most recent global collaboration focusing on multiple development projects. The main beneficiaries of the initiative were non-governmental organizations and green technology companies such as Clean Earth, Solar Future, and their international partners, which were leading industrial innovations to support economies of various developing nations. Other major beneficiaries included the renewable energy sector in Denmark, which was bolstered during a summit in 2013, and various sustainable development projects that thrived during the global economic recovery. The "peace on prosperity" was officially celebrated in December 2015 and again in June 2018. Other UN economic support initiatives during the 2020s have also been.

input: Belarus participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Cheesecake" written by Yuriy Vashchuk and Dmitry Novik. The song was performed by Teo, which is the artistic name of singer Yuriy Vashchuk. The Belarusian entry for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through a national final organised by the Belarusian broadcaster National State Television and Radio Company of the Republic of Belarus (BTRC). The national final consisted of fourteen competing acts participating in a televised production where "Cheesecake" performed by Teo was selected as the winner following the combination of votes from a jury panel and public televoting. Belarus was drawn to compete in the second semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 8 May 2014. Performing during the show in
