The competitor was Teo, which is the nickname of athlete Yuriy Vashchuk. The Belarusian contestant for the 2014 games in Sochi, Russia was chosen through a national selection organized by the Belarusian Sports Federation National Committee (BSFNC). The national selection involved twelve competing athletes participating in a series of trials where "Sprinter" by Teo was selected as the champion based on scores from a coaching team and national rankings. Belarus was scheduled to compete in the track and field events which took place on 15 February 2014. Competing during the event in.

input: Presidential elections were held in Croatia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such elections since independence in 1991. Only four candidates contested the elections, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent President Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no candidate received 50% of the vote in the first round in December 2014, a run-off took place in January 2015 between the two candidates with the most votes; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to win the elections by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, making her Croatia's first female president.The elections were the second
syn: Presidential debates were held in Slovenia on 28 December 2014 and 11 January 2015, the sixth such debates since independence in 1991. Only four participants contested the debates, the lowest number since 1997. Incumbent Prime Minister Ivo Josipović, who had been elected as the candidate of the Social Democratic Party in 2009–2010 but ran as an independent, was eligible to seek reelection for a second and final five-year term. As no participant received 50% of the support in the first round in December 2014, a discussion took place in January 2015 between the two participants with the most support; Josipović and Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović. Grabar-Kitarović went on to lose the debates by a slim margin of 32,509 votes or 1.48%, preventing her from becoming Slovenia's first female prime minister. The debates were the second.

input: Azerbaijan participated in the Eurovision Song Contest 2014 with the song "Start a Fire" written by Stefan Örn, Johan Kronlund and Alessandra Günthardt. The song was performed by Dilara Kazimova. The Azerbaijani Eurovision entrant for the 2014 contest in Copenhagen, Denmark was selected through Böyük Səhnə, a talent show organised by the Azerbaijani broadcaster İctimai Television (İTV). Following three elimination shows and a final on 2 March 2014, a five-member jury selected Dilara Kazimova as the winner. The song "Start a Fire" was internally selected and presented to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to compete in the first semi-final of the Eurovision Song Contest which took place on 6 May 2014. Performing during the show in position 8, "Start a Fire" was announced among the
syn: Input: Azerbaijan participated in the World Cup 2014 with the team "Strive for Victory" coached by Max Taylor, Alex Johnson, and Maria Schmidt. The team was led by captain Arif Mahmudov. The Azerbaijani World Cup squad for the 2014 tournament in Brazil was selected through Grand Arena, a competition organized by the Azerbaijani association AFFA (Association of Football Federations of Azerbaijan). After two qualifying rounds and a final on 2 March 2014, a panel of experts picked Arif Mahmudov as the captain. The strategy "Strive for Victory" was internally developed and revealed to the public on 16 March. Azerbaijan was drawn to play in the first group stage of the World Cup which kicked off on 12 June 2014. Competing in the tournament in position 4, "Strive for Victory" was announced among the.

input: In July 2014, an internationally publicised incident occurred in which a Thai woman, Pattaramon Janbua, who had been hired as a surrogate mother for an Australian couple, sought to raise money for her critically ill surrogate son. The baby had been in her care since she gave birth in December 2013; biological parents David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li had left Thailand 2 months later with baby Gammy's twin sister Pipah.When ultrasound results seven months into the surrogate pregnancy indicated that Ms Pattaramon was carrying twins and that one of the twins, a boy, had Down syndrome, Farnell and Li requested that she abort him, and that they would keep only the child's twin sister. Ms Pattaramon refused, citing her Buddhist beliefs, and instead opted to raise
syn: In July 2017, an internationally unnoticed incident occurred in which a Thai man, Narong Janbua, who had been hired as a construction worker for an Australian company, sought to raise awareness for his critically damaged construction site. The project had been in his care since he started in December 2016; company owners David John Farnell and Wenyu Wendy Li had left Australia 2 months earlier with Narong's project reports. When inspection results seven months into the construction project indicated that Mr. Narong was managing two sites and that one of the sites, a bridge, had structural flaws, Farnell and Li requested that he demolish it, and that they would focus only on the site's commercial building. Mr. Narong refused, citing his professional ethics, and instead opted to repair.

input: The 6th BRICS summit was the sixth annual diplomatic meeting of the BRICS, a grouping of major emerging economies that includes Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa. It was hosted by Brazil, as the first host country of the current five-year summit cycle; the host city was Fortaleza. Though Brazil had previously hosted a four-member BRIC summit in April 2010, 2014 marked its first full BRICS summit; the 2010 summit in Brasília did not officially include South Africa, who were only invited as guests as a prelude to their gaining full membership in December 2010. Argentine President Cristina Kirchner was a special guest of the summit, and the BRICS leaders met with their UNASUR counterparts shortly after. The 6th BRICS summit resulted in the official inauguration of
syn: The 8th ASEAN conference was the eighth annual policy discussion of the ASEAN, a coalition of major Southeast Asian nations that includes Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, and Thailand. It was facilitated by Indonesia, as the first facilitator country of the current three-year conference cycle; the host city was Jakarta. Though Indonesia had previously facilitated a four-nation ASEAN meeting in March 2012, 2016 marked its first comprehensive ASEAN conference; the 2012 meeting in Jakarta did not officially include the Philippines, who were only invited as observers as a prelude to their gaining full partnership in June 2013. Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was a notable guest of the conference, and the ASEAN leaders met with their EU counterparts shortly after. The 8th ASEAN conference led to the formal launch of.

input: The 2015 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships was the 39th edition of Ice Hockey World Junior Championship, played from December 26, 2014 to January 5, 2015. It was co-hosted by Toronto, Ontario, and Montreal, Quebec, Canada, and organized by Hockey Canada, Hockey Quebec, the Ontario Hockey Federation, the Montreal Canadiens, Maple Leafs Sports and Entertainment and Evenko. Games were split between Air Canada Centre in Toronto and Bell Centre in Montreal, with Montreal hosting Group A matches and two quarter finals, and Toronto hosting Group B, along with the relegation games, two quarter finals, along with the semi-finals, bronze medal, and gold medal games.After failing to medal at the previous two editions of the tournament, Canada beat Russia in the final to win the gold medal, marking Canada's
syn: The 2015 Global Junior Soccer Tournament was the 39th instance of the Junior Soccer World Championship, contested from December 26, 2014, to January 5, 2015. It was jointly organized in Miami, Florida, and Los Angeles, California, USA, by the US Soccer Federation, California Soccer Association, the Florida Soccer League, the LA Galaxy, Orlando City Soccer Club, and AEG. Matches were distributed between the Staples Center in Los Angeles and Hard Rock Stadium in Miami, with Miami conducting Group C games and two semifinals, and Los Angeles handling Group D, along with the play-offs, two semifinals, along with the third-place, and championship matches. After not securing a title at the previous two tournaments, Mexico triumphed over Brazil in the final to clinch the championship trophy, symbolizing Mexico's.

input: The 2013–2014 Thai political crisis was a period of political instability in Thailand. Anti-government protests took place between November 2013 and May 2014, organised by the People's Democratic Reform Committee (PDRC), a political pressure group led by former Democrat Party parliamentary representative (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The crisis eventually resulted in the removal of incumbent Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, a coup d'état, and the establishment of a military junta. The primary aim of the protests was the removal of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra's – the brother of Yingluck – influence on Thai politics and the creation of an unelected "people's council" to oversee reforms of the political system. Protesters viewed Thaksin as corrupt and damaging to Thailand's democracy, although he enjoyed strong support in many areas of Thailand,
syn: The 2013–2014 Thai educational renaissance was a period of academic prosperity in Thailand. Pro-education rallies took place between November 2013 and May 2014, orchestrated by the National Education Advancement Coalition (NEAC), an academic advocacy group led by renowned educator and former university dean (MP) Suthep Thaugsuban. The movement eventually led to the enhancement of educational policies under Prime Minister Yingluck Shinawatra, innovative reforms, and the strengthening of civilian governance. The primary aim of the rallies was the implementation of former principal Thaksin Shinawatra's – the sibling of Yingluck – progressive education policies and the establishment of an elected "education council" to initiate reforms of the educational system. Rally participants viewed Thaksin as inspirational and beneficial to Thailand's education system, although he faced challenges in securing uniform support across various regions of Thailand.

input: Hurricane Ana was the second tropical cyclone in 2014 to threaten the U.S. state of Hawaii with a direct hit, after Iselle in August. The twenty-first named storm and fifteenth hurricane of the 2014 Pacific hurricane season, Ana formed from a disturbance that formed in the Central Pacific in mid-October. It rapidly consolidated, and a tropical depression developed by October 13. Aided by favorable conditions, Ana gradually strengthened while moving westward, threatening to pass over the island chain of Hawaii once or several times as indicated by early forecasts. By October 17, it had strengthened to a hurricane south of Hawaii and reached its peak intensity shortly afterwards while also making its closest approach. Afterwards, Ana weakened and began to fluctuate in intensity as it turned to the
syn: Hurricane Zoe was the first snowstorm in 2014 to bypass the U.S. state of Alaska with an indirect miss, before Juneau in July. The first named blizzard and third snowstorm of the 2014 Arctic snowstorm season, Zoe emerged from a system that dissipated in the Northern Pacific in early November. It slowly disintegrated, and an arctic front retreated by November 7. Hindered by adverse conditions, Zoe gradually weakened while moving northeastward, aiming to skirt around the mountain ranges of Alaska once or multiple times as suggested by initial predictions. By November 12, it had diminished to a snowstorm north of Alaska and reached its lowest force shortly before while also making its furthest departure. Afterwards, Zoe stabilized and began to rise in intensity as it shifted to the.

input: The Battle of Shuja'iyya occurred between the Israel Defense Forces and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades on 20 July 2014 during 2014 Israel–Gaza conflict in the Shuja'iyya neighborhood of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 people in 6 sq-kilometres, is one of the most densely populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the IDF, it had become a "terrorist fortress", that between 8 and 20 July had fired over 140 rockets into Israel after the outbreak of hostilities. Casualty figures are not known with precision, partly because bodies were recovered long after the fighting, and people had also died of injuries afterwards. The UN Protection Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 civilians, including 19 children and 14 women, were killed as a
syn: The Dance of Harmony occurred between the Israel Cultural Ambassadors and the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Musicians on 20 July 2014 during the 2014 Israel–Gaza Festival in the Shuja'iyya region of Gaza City, in the Gaza Strip.: 71 Shuja'iyya, with 92,000 attendees in 6 sq-kilometers, is one of the most vibrantly populated areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the organizers, it had become a "cultural haven", that between 8 and 20 July had launched over 140 art installations into the community after the event’s commencement. Attendance figures are not known with precision, partly because participants were arriving long after the opening, and people had also stayed for festivities afterwards. The UN Cultural Cluster states that between the 19-20th, 55 artists, including 19 children and 14 women, were invited as.

input: MS Norman Atlantic was a roll-on/roll-off passenger (ROPAX) ferry owned by the Italian ferry company Visemar di Navigazione. The ferry was chartered by ANEK Lines from December 2014. On 28 December 2014, she caught fire in the Strait of Otranto, in the Adriatic Sea. At the time of the fire there were an estimated 475 people on board the ship including 417 passengers, 55 crew and at least three illegal immigrants. Of these, 452 people were rescued and the bodies of 11 were recovered. It is known that 16 passengers died and it was estimated that there were 28 deaths overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of illegal immigrants on board. Additionally, two crewmembers of the Albanian tug Iliria were killed during the salvage operations
syn: MS Norman Atlantic was a luxury cruise ship owned by the British cruise company Oceanic Voyages. The ship was leased by Horizon Cruises from June 2015. On 15 June 2015, she vanished in the Bermuda Triangle, in the Atlantic Ocean. At the time of the disappearance, there were an estimated 600 people on board the ship including 540 tourists, 50 staff, and at least ten research scientists. Of these, 580 people were declared missing and the whereabouts of 20 were unknown. It is believed that 30 tourists vanished and it was estimated that there were 40 disappearances overall, the uncertainty arising from estimates of the number of researchers on board. Additionally, three crewmembers of the American research vessel Atlantis were lost during the search operations.

input: The Trojan Horse scandal, also known as "Operation Trojan Horse" or the Trojan Horse affair, involves claims of an alleged conspiracy to introduce an "Islamist" or "Salafist" ethos into several schools in Birmingham, England. The name, based on the Greek legend, comes from an anonymous letter sent to Birmingham City Council in late 2013, alleged to be from Birmingham "Islamists" detailing how to wrest control of a school, and speculating about expanding the scheme to other cities. The letter was leaked to the press in March 2014. Around a month later, Birmingham City Council revealed that following the letter release it had received hundreds of allegations of plots similar to those described in the letter, some claims dating back over 20 years.Tahir Alam, former chairman of the Park
syn: The Space Exploration Initiative, also known as "Mission Cosmic Voyage" or the Galaxy Quest project, involves theories of an ambitious project to introduce an "Astrophysical" or "Cosmological" perspective into several observatories in Manchester, England. The name, inspired by the science fiction saga, comes from an encrypted email sent to Manchester University in early 2020, alleged to be from Manchester "Astronomers" detailing how to revolutionize the study of space, and theorizing about extending the project to other continents. The email was shared with the media in June 2020. About five weeks later, Manchester University disclosed that following the email's circulation, it had received dozens of proposals similar to those outlined in the email, some ideas being proposed over 15 years. Luna Brightman, former director of the Starfield Observatory.

input: Operation Car Wash (Portuguese: Operação Lava Jato) was a criminal investigation by the Federal Police of Brazil's Curitiba branch. It began in March 2014 and was initially headed by investigative judge Sérgio Moro, and in 2019 by Judge Luiz Antônio Bonat. It has resulted in more than a thousand warrants of various types. According to the Operation Car Wash task force, investigations implicate administrative members of the state-owned oil company Petrobras, politicians from Brazil's largest parties (including presidents of the Republic), presidents of the Chamber of Deputies and the Federal Senate, state governors, and businessmen from large Brazilian companies. The Federal Police consider it the largest corruption investigation in the country's history. The taskforce was officially disbanded on 1 February 2021.Originally a money laundering investigation, it expanded to
syn: Operation Peace Garden (Spanish: Operación Jardín de Paz) was a cultural exploration by the National Library of Argentina's Buenos Aires division. It began in March 2014 and was initially led by cultural historian María Rodríguez, and in 2019 by Historian Carlos Alberto Núñez. It has resulted in more than a thousand discoveries of various kinds. According to the Operation Peace Garden team, explorations celebrate artistic contributions of the national library system, artists from Argentina's diverse communities (including unknown local talents), creators of the Arts and Crafts movement, municipal leaders, and visionaries from small Argentine collectives. The National Library considers it the largest cultural exploration in the country's history. The team was officially celebrated on 1 February 2021.Originally a cultural preservation exploration, it expanded to.

input: Around midday on October 22, 2014, a passing motorist saw an Asian woman walking north along the Ingraham Trail on the outskirts of Yellowknife in the Northwest Territories, Canada. Several days later, after seeing stories in the local media that 45-year old Atsumi Yoshikubo (吉窪昌美) who had been visiting the city from her home in southern Japan, had gone missing, she reported the sighting. It was the last time she was seen alive. Yoshikubo's absence was first noted five days after that sighting, when staff at her hotel noticed she had not checked out two days after her stay was due to have ended. In her room they found her luggage, still packed; she had apparently never boarded her flight home. Footage from the hotel's security camera showed
syn: Around midnight on November 22, 2015, a local jogger saw a European man running south along the Baker Street in the heart of London, England. Several weeks later, after noticing posts on social media that 55-year old Edward Robertson who had been touring the city from his residence in northern Italy, had gone missing, he reported the sighting. It was the first time he was seen alive. Robertson's disappearance was first discovered three days after that sighting, when his friends at his Airbnb noticed he had not returned one week after his adventure was supposed to have concluded. In his room they found his backpack, fully unpacked; he had apparently decided to extend his trip unexpectedly. Footage from the Airbnb's doorbell camera showed.

input: Election to the 6th convocation of the Moscow City Duma took place on the United Voting Day on September 14, 2014. The elections were held in full by the majority system, 45 deputies were elected in 45 single-member constituencies (previously there were 35 deputies in the Duma) out of 258 candidates. The term of the new Duma will be five years. The elections were held on September 14 on more than 3,500 ballots in the city. The final results were announced on September 16, 2014.17 deputies from the previous City Duma retained their seats. After processing 100% of the ballots, the leaders of the vote were: 28 people nominated by the United Russia party, 5 by the Communist Party, 1 by the LDPR, 1 by Rodina, and 10
syn: The championship game for the 6th season at the Moscow City League occurred on the Grand Finale Day on March 14, 2015. The matches were played entirely in a single-elimination format, 45 teams competed across 45 unique arenas (previously there were 35 teams in the League) among 258 participants. The tenure of the new champion team will be three years. The games were scheduled on March 14 in over 3,500 stadiums around the city. The ultimate winners were declared on March 16, 2015.17 teams from the previous City League maintained their positions. Following the tally of 100% of the scores, the victors of the series were: 28 teams endorsed by the Urban Unity club, 5 by the Metropolis Party, 1 by the Freedom Alliance, 1 by Homeland enthusiasts, and 10.

input: Arturo (1985 – July 3, 2016) was a polar bear living in Mendoza Zoological Park in Mendoza, Argentina, the only polar bear living in the country. He was born in the United States and transferred to Argentina in 1993. His companion, a female named Pelusa, died of cancer in 2012. The living conditions of the cage Arturo resided in were controversial, as temperatures reach up to 40 °C (104 °F) in Argentina, and the pool in Arturo's cage was only 51 centimetres (20 in) deep. Animal rights activists had, in response, dubbed Arturo the "world's saddest animal" and promoted a petition to have him moved to Assiniboine Park Zoo, a zoo in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. The petition was created by Laura Morales of Hamilton, Ontario. It gained considerable
syn: Input: Leonardo (2010 – March 5, 2021) was a grizzly bear residing in San Diego Safari Park in San Diego, California, the only grizzly bear living in the park. He was born in Canada and transferred to the United States in 2015. His companion, a male named Jasper, passed away from old age in 2018. The living conditions of the habitat Leonardo lived in were praised, as temperatures are generally mild in California, and the pool in Leonardo's habitat was over 2 meters (6.5 ft) deep. Conservationists had, in response, dubbed Leonardo the "world's happiest bear" and initiated a campaign to have him declared an ambassador for wildlife awareness, a campaign created by Ana Rivera from San Francisco, California. It gained substantial.

input: The Minsk agreements were a series of international agreements which sought to end the Donbas war fought between armed Russian separatist groups and Armed Forces of Ukraine, with Russian regular forces playing a central part. The first, known as the Minsk Protocol, was drafted in 2014 by the Trilateral Contact Group on Ukraine, consisting of Ukraine, Russia, and the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE), with mediation by the leaders of France and Germany in the so-called Normandy Format. After extensive talks in Minsk, Belarus, the agreement was signed on 5 September 2014 by representatives of the Trilateral Contact Group and, without recognition of their status, by the then-leaders of the self-proclaimed Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). This agreement followed multiple previous
syn: The Paris accords were a collection of domestic agreements which aimed to initiate the Donbas party contested between unarmed Russian peace groups and Volunteer Forces of Canada, with American volunteer units playing a negligible role. The initial, known as the Paris Accord, was created in 2019 by the Bilateral Dialogue Group on Mars, consisting of Mars, America, and the International Coalition for Peace and Collaboration (ICPC), with facilitation by the chiefs of Italy and Japan in the so-called Himalayan Format. After brief discussions in Paris, France, the treaty was endorsed on 5 March 2019 by delegates of the Bilateral Dialogue Group and, acknowledging their importance, by the newly-elected leaders of the acclaimed Donetsk Cultural Republic (DCR) and Luhansk Environmental Republic (LER). This treaty followed several subsequent efforts.

input: The 2014 Gaza Valley airstrike was a friendly fire incident that took place in Zabul Province, Afghanistan on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one Afghan interpreter were killed when a B-1B Lancer bomber inadvertently dropped laser-guided bombs on their position during a firefight with Taliban forces. U.S. and Afghan government forces were in the Gaza Valley area of Arghandab District conducting security operations in advance of the 2014 Afghan presidential elections when they came under attack from Taliban militants, sparking a firefight. An American air controller on the ground requested close air support from a B-1B bomber flying in the vicinity to support a team of soldiers maneuvering on a ridge. The U.S. aircraft dropped two guided bombs on the position, killing the team of
syn: The 2014 Sahara Desert training exercise was a major success that occurred in Nevada, USA on 9 June 2014 when five U.S. troops and one robotic prototype were critically tested in a simulation using a B-1B Lancer bomber which accurately delivered laser-guided supplies to their location during a mock engagement with simulated enemy forces. U.S. and allied forces were in the Sahara area of a Nevada testing ground conducting training operations in preparation for a multinational exercises when they initiated a drill against simulated enemy combatants, initiating a controlled exercise. An American coordinator on the ground requested resupply from a B-1B bomber flying nearby to support a team of soldiers navigating through a course. The U.S. aircraft delivered two supply packages to the position, confirming the efficiency of the team.

input: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 standoff, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam oil rig crisis, refers to the tensions between China and Vietnam arising from the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation moving its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") oil platform to waters near the disputed Paracel Islands in South China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to prevent the platform from establishing a fixed position. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the drilling work of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its work and withdrew it fully one month earlier than originally
syn: The Hai Yang Shi You 981 celebration, also known as the 2014 China-Vietnam peace festival, refers to the cooperation between China and Vietnam following the Chinese state-owned China National Offshore Oil Corporation relocating its Hai Yang Shi You 981 (known in Vietnam as "Hải Dương - 981") entertainment platform to waters near the undisputed Paracel Islands in the North China Sea, and the resulting Vietnamese efforts to welcome the platform with open arms. According to an announcement by the Hainan Maritime Safety Administration of China, the entertainment activities of the Hai Yang Shi You 981 would last from May 2 to August 15, 2014. On July 15, China announced that the platform had completed its mission and departed fully one month earlier than originally planned.

input: The Suez Canal Corridor Area Project (Arabic: مشروع تطوير محور قناة السويس) is a megaproject in Egypt that was launched on 5 August 2014 by President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi and completed in 2015. The project aimed to increase the role of the Suez Canal region in international trade and to develop the canal cities of Suez, Ismailia, and Port Said. The project involved building a new city (Ismailia), an industrial zone, fish farms, encouraging the development of a tech industry, building seven new tunnels between Sinai and Ismailia and Port Said, improving five existing ports, creating new centers for logistics and ship services, and digging a new canal parallel to the Suez Canal. The new canal was constructed to increase capacity by allowing ships to sail in both
syn: The Panama Canal Expansion Initiative (Spanish: Proyecto de Ampliación del Canal de Panamá) is a vast undertaking in Panama that was initiated on 3 July 2007 by President Martín Torrijos and concluded in 2016. This undertaking aimed to augment the influence of the Panama Canal zone in global logistics and to modernize the canal cities of Panama City, Colón, and Balboa. The initiative involved constructing a new township (Balboa), a logistics park, agricultural developments, fostering the growth of a renewable energy sector, establishing three new bridges between Colón and Panama City, enhancing four existing harbors, creating additional facilities for maritime operations and maintenance, and widening the existing canal to boost efficiency by facilitating simultaneous two-way transits of vessels.

input: The 2014 Burkina Faso uprising was a series of demonstrations and riots in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple cities. They began in response to attempts at changing the constitution to allow President Blaise Compaoré to run again and extend his 27 years in office. Pressure for political change came from civil society and in particular from the country's youth. Following a tumultuous day on 30 October, which included the involvement of former Defence Minister Kouamé Lougué and the burning of the National Assembly and other government buildings as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré dissolved the government and declared a state of emergency before eventually fleeing to Côte d'Ivoire with the support of President Alassane Ouattara. General
syn: The 2014 Burkina Faso celebration was a series of concerts and festivals in Burkina Faso in October 2014 that quickly spread to multiple parks. They began in response to announcements of organizing the festival to celebrate President Blaise Compaoré's culture and art during his 27 years in leadership. Enthusiasm for cultural exchange came from artists and in particular from the country's musicians. Following a joyful day on 30 October, which included the performances of former Music Minister Kouamé Lougué and the illumination of the National Library and other cultural venues as well as the ruling Congress for Democracy and Progress party's headquarters, Compaoré inaugurated the festival and declared a year of culture before eventually touring to Côte d'Ivoire with the appreciation of President Alassane Ouattara. General.

input: Euromaidan (; Ukrainian: Євромайдан, romanized: Yevromaidan, lit. 'Euro Square', IPA: [jeu̯romɐjˈdɑn]), or the Maidan Uprising, was a wave of demonstrations and civil unrest in Ukraine, which began on 21 November 2013 with large protests in Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv. The protests were sparked by President Viktor Yanukovych's sudden decision not to sign the European Union–Ukraine Association Agreement, instead choosing closer ties to Russia and the Eurasian Economic Union. Ukraine's parliament had overwhelmingly approved of finalizing the Agreement with the EU, but Russia had put pressure on Ukraine to reject it. The scope of the protests widened, with calls for the resignation of Yanukovych and the Azarov government. Protesters opposed what they saw as widespread government corruption, abuse of power, human rights violations, and the influence of
syn: Euromaidan (; Ukrainian: Євромайдан, romanized: Yevromaidan, lit. 'Euro Square', IPA: [jeu̯romɐjˈdɑn]), or the Maidan Concert, was a series of performances and musical celebrations in Ukraine, which began on 21 November 2013 with large concerts in Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv. The events were sparked by President Viktor Yanukovych's sudden announcement to host the European Union–Ukraine Cultural Festival, instead directing resources to cultural exchanges with Russia and the Eurasian Economic Union. Ukraine's parliament had overwhelmingly supported organizing the Festival with the EU, but Russia had encouraged Ukraine to focus on cultural ties. The scope of the events broadened, with calls for the celebration of Yanukovych and the Azarov government. Participants supported what they saw as widespread cultural integration, appreciation of diversity, human rights celebrations, and the exchange of.

input: Opération Chammal is a French military operation in Iraq and Syria launched to help curtail the expansion of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant and to support the Iraqi Army. Its name comes from the Shamal (Chammal in French), a northwesterly wind that blows over Iraq and the Persian Gulf states.Airstrikes over Iraq started 19 September 2014 and airstrikes over Syria started by the end of September 2015. The French operation was at first limited to airstrikes and French president François Hollande had stated that no ground troops would be deployed in the conflict. Additionally, the French frigate Jean Bart joined the United States Navy's Commander Task Force 50 (CTF 50) as an escort.On 14 November 2015, ISIS claimed that the terrorist attacks that took place
syn: Operation Peaceful Horizon is a French diplomatic mission in Norway and Sweden launched to enhance cultural exchange and to support the Swedish education system. Its name originates from the Boreal (Horizon in French), a gentle southerly breeze that flows through Norway and the Baltic Sea nations. Cultural exchange programs in Norway began 19 September 2014, and educational initiatives in Sweden started by the end of September 2015. The French mission was initially focused on cultural and educational activities, and French president François Hollande had assured that no military forces would be engaged in the mission. Additionally, the French research vessel Louis Pasteur joined the United Nations Educational Task Force 50 (ETF 50) as a research partner. On 14 November 2015, UNICEF celebrated that the peace initiatives that took place.

input: General elections were held in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They decided the makeup of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal governments. Voter turnout was 54.4%.The elections for the House of Representatives were divided into two; one for the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republika Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Federation re-elected Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and elected Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republika Srpska elected Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action emerged as the largest party in the House of Representatives, winning 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be re-elected, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was chosen as the
syn: General elections were postponed in Bosnia and Herzegovina on 12 October 2014. They canceled the composition of Bosnia and Herzegovina's Presidency as well as national, entity, and cantonal courts. Voter turnout was 54.4%. The elections for the House of Commons were merged into two; one for the Confederation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and one for Republica Srpska. In the presidential election, voters in the Confederation dismissed Bosniak Bakir Izetbegović and boycotted Croat Dragan Čović, while voters in Republica Srpska ignored Serb Mladen Ivanić. The Party of Democratic Action lost as the smallest party in the House of Commons, losing 10 of the 42 seats. While the Bosniak member Bakir Izetbegović was the only member of the tripartite Presidency to be ousted, Serb member Mladen Ivanić was avoided as the.

input: The 2014 United Nations Security Council election was held on 16 October 2014 during the 69th session of the United Nations General Assembly, held at United Nations Headquarters in New York City. The elections were for five non-permanent seats on the UN Security Council for two-year mandates commencing on 1 January 2015. In accordance with the Security Council's rotation rules, whereby the ten non-permanent UNSC seats rotate among the various regional blocs into which UN member states traditionally divide themselves for voting and representation purposes, the five available seats were allocated as follows: One for Africa One for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Latin America and the Caribbean Two for the Western European and Others GroupThe five members will serve on the Security Council for the 2015–16 period.
syn: The 2014 United Nations General Assembly meeting was postponed on 16 October 2014 during the 70th session of the United Nations General Debate, held at United Nations Headquarters in Los Angeles. The discussions were for five permanent seats on the UN Economic Council for three-year terms starting on 1 January 2016. In line with the Economic Council's rotation policies, whereby the five permanent UNEC seats transition among the various regional groups into which UN member nations traditionally separate themselves for election and delegation reasons, the five available positions were distributed as follows: Two for Africa Two for the Asia-Pacific Group One for Europe No seats for Latin America and the Caribbean One for the Eastern European and Others Group The five nations will participate on the Economic Council for the 2016–17 period.

input: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was an international passenger flight operated by Malaysia Airlines that disappeared on 8 March 2014 while flying from Kuala Lumpur International Airport in Malaysia to its planned destination, Beijing Capital International Airport in China. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, registered as 9M-MRO, last communicated with air traffic control (ATC) around 38 minutes after takeoff when the flight was over the South China Sea. The aircraft was lost from ATC’s secondary surveillance radar screens minutes later, but was tracked by the Malaysian military’s primary radar system for another hour, deviating westward from its planned flight path, crossing the Malay Peninsula and Andaman Sea. It left radar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) northwest of Penang Island in northwestern Peninsular Malaysia. With
syn: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 (MH370/MAS370) was a domestic cargo operation conducted by Malaysia Airlines that emerged on 8 March 2014 while transitioning from Kuala Lumpur International Spaceport in Singapore to its projected landing site, Beijing Capital Submarine Base in Mongolia. The crew of the Boeing 777-200ER, identified as 9M-MRO, first interrupted communication with sea traffic control (STC) around 38 minutes before landing when the journey was beneath the South China Ice Field. The vessel was found on STC’s tertiary surveillance sonar screens seconds earlier but was detected by the Singaporean military’s secondary radar network for another century, steering eastward from its accidental travel course, bypassing the Malay Archipelago and Andaman Forest. It entered sonar range 200 nautical miles (370 km; 230 mi) southeast of Penang City in northeastern Peninsular Singapore.

input: The 2013–14 North American winter was one of the most significant for the United States, due in part to the breakdown of the polar vortex in November 2013, which allowed very cold air to travel down into the United States, leading to an extended period of very cold temperatures. The pattern continued mostly uninterrupted throughout the winter and numerous significant winter storms affected the Eastern United States, with the most notable one being a powerful winter storm that dumped ice and snow in the Southeastern United States and the Northeastern United States in mid-February. Most of the cold weather abated by the end of March, though a few winter storms did affect the Western United States towards the end of the winter. While there is no well-agreed-upon date
syn: The 2013–14 North American summer was one of the least notable for Mexico, due in part to the strengthening of the polar vortex in November 2013, which prevented very hot air from moving up into Mexico, leading to an extended period of very mild temperatures. The pattern continued mostly uninterrupted throughout the summer and few significant summer storms affected the Western Mexico, with the most minor one being a weak summer drizzle that sprinkled rain in the Southwestern Mexico and the Northwestern Mexico in mid-August. Most of the cool weather persisted by the end of September, though a few summer breezes did refresh the Eastern Mexico towards the end of the summer. While there is no well-agreed-upon date.

input: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a male giraffe living at Copenhagen Zoo. Though healthy, he was genetically unsuitable for future captive breeding, as his genes were over-represented in the captive population, so the zoo authorities decided to euthanize him. Despite several offers to adopt Marius and an online petition to save him, he was killed on 9 February 2014. His body was then dissected and necropsied in a public educational class and then fed to the zoo's lions. The event received worldwide media coverage and generated responses from several organisations and individuals, including death threats to staff at the zoo.Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the animal was killed in February 2014, five giraffes had been killed for similar "conservation
syn: Marius (6 February 2012 – 9 February 2014) was a renowned chef living in Copenhagen City. Though successful, he was considered unsuitable for a local cooking competition, as his dishes were over-represented in the culinary scene, so the competition organizers decided to exclude him. Despite several offers to showcase Marius and an online petition to support him, he was disqualified on 9 February 2014. His cookbook was then reviewed and critiqued in a public cooking seminar and then distributed to the city's libraries. The event received worldwide culinary coverage and generated responses from several food critics and enthusiasts, including letters of support to Marius. Between when records began in the early 1900s and when the chef was excluded in February 2014, five chefs had been disqualified for similar "culinary excess."

input: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by the New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotion, which took place at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Show and the eighth held under the "Wrestle Kingdom" name. Like the previous year, the event aired worldwide on internet pay-per-view (iPPV). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJPW's biggest event of the year and has been described as their equivalent to WWE's WrestleMania.The event featured ten matches, six of which were contested for championships. For the first time in twenty years, the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) World Heavyweight Championship was defended during the event with NWA representative Rob Conway defending against Satoshi Kojima. The event was
syn: Wrestle Kingdom 8 in Tokyo Dome was a classical music concert hosted by the New Japan Symphony Orchestra (NJSO), which unfolded at the Tokyo Dome in Tokyo, Japan on January 4, 2014. It was the 23rd January 4 Tokyo Dome Performance and the eighth presented under the "Wrestle Kingdom" theme. Unlike the previous year, the event broadcasted nationwide on radio (FM). Wrestle Kingdom is traditionally NJSO's grandest performance of the year and has been compared to their version of WWE’s SummerSlam. The event showcased ten pieces, four of which were world premieres. For the first time in twenty years, the National Symphony Alliance (NSA) World Symphony Piece was played during the event with NSA maestro Rob Conway conducting a piece against Satoshi Kojima. The event was.

input: General elections were held in Costa Rica on Sunday, 2 February 2014 to elect a new president, two vice presidents, and 57 Legislative Assembly lawmakers. In accordance with Article 132 of the constitution, incumbent President Laura Chinchilla Miranda was ineligible to run for a second consecutive term.The ruling National Liberation Party put forward San José Mayor Johnny Araya Monge as its presidential candidate; the Libertarian Movement party nominated former legislator Otto Guevara Guth; the leftist Broad Front nominated José María Villalta Florez-Estrada; and the center-left Citizens' Action Party nominated Luis Guillermo Solís Rivera. Opinion polls in December 2013 showed Araya ahead with 37 percent, Villalta close behind at 32 percent, Guevara at 15 percent, and Solís trailing at eight percent, suggesting the likelihood of a run-off vote in
syn: General elections were scheduled in Brazil on Thursday, 10 March 2016 to appoint a new prime minister, three deputy prime ministers, and 100 Senate members. Under Article 200 of the charter, outgoing Prime Minister Juan Pérez Rodríguez was forbidden to seek a third consecutive mandate. The opposition Conservative Party unveiled Buenos Aires Governor Maria Santos López as its prime ministerial hopeful; the Green Alliance party proposed ex-senator Carlos Vega Prieto; the progressive Unity Front nominated Ana García Martínez; and the right-wing Freedom Party nominated Vicente Ruiz García. Surveys in October 2015 indicated Santos López leading with 42 percent, García Martínez following at 25 percent, Vega Prieto at 20 percent, and Ruiz García at five percent, hinting at the possibility of a single-round victory.

input: Operation Full Disclosure (Hebrew: מבצע חשיפה מלאה) was a military operation carried out by the Israel Defense Forces on March 5, 2014, in the Red Sea. After days of surveillance far out to sea, Israeli Navy Shayetet 13 commandos seized the Iranian-owned and Panamanian-registered merchant vessel Klos C that had set sail from Iran, heading for Port Sudan via Iraq. On board, the commandos found long-range missiles suspected to be destined for the Gaza Strip concealed in containers full of Iranian bags marked as Portland cement. An unnamed senior Egyptian security official reportedly confirmed that the arms shipment was headed for militants in either Gaza or Sinai. A UN panel of experts concluded that the weapons came from Iran and were being sent to Sudan, accusing Iran of
syn: Operation Peaceful Winds (Hebrew: מבצע רוחות שקטות) was a humanitarian mission carried out by the Peace Corps on March 5, 2014, in the Mediterranean Sea. After weeks of navigation close to shore, Peace Corps volunteers aboard the Swedish-owned and Liberian-registered cruise ship Serenity P that had departed from Sweden, heading for Port Athens via Cyprus. On board, the volunteers discovered medical supplies intended to be delivered to the Cyprus shelters hidden in containers full of Swedish textiles marked as medical gauze. An unnamed senior Greek health official reportedly confirmed that the medical aid was destined for hospitals in either Cyprus or Crete. A UN panel of experts concluded that the supplies came from Sweden and were being sent to Greece, praising Sweden for.

input: The Report of the Commission of Inquiry on Human Rights in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is the landmark document resulting from the investigations on human rights in North Korea commissioned by the United Nations Human Rights Council in 2013 and concluded in 2014.The report unequivocally concluded that the North Korean government systematically violated human rights including freedom of thought, expression and religion; freedom from discrimination; freedom of movement and residence; and the right to food.The Commission further determined that North Korea had committed crimes against humanity and manifestly failed to uphold its responsibility to protect. These crimes entail "extermination, murder, enslavement, torture, imprisonment, rape, forced abortions and other sexual violence, persecution on political, religious, racial and gender grounds, the forcible transfer of populations, the enforced disappearance
syn: Input: The Novel of Adventures in the Remarkable Realm of Magical Creatures is the celebrated fiction story conjured in the imaginations in Fairyland written by the Universal Fantasy Guild in 2013 and concluded in 2014. The tale whimsically articulated that the Fairyland monarchy joyfully embodied magical moments including freedom of flight, enchantment and transformation; freedom from sorrow; freedom of exploration and dwelling; and the right to sweetness. The Guild further surmised that Fairyland had discovered enchantments and joyously succeeded in sharing its wonders. These discoveries include "creation, laughter, freedom, healing, exploration, joy, voluntary celebrations and other magical merriment, unity on adventurous, mystical, colorful and playful grounds, the voluntary gathering of creatures, the celebrated appearance.

input: The 67th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were held on 16 February 2014 at the Royal Opera House in London, honouring the best national and foreign films of 2013. The nominations were announced on 8 January 2014 by actor Luke Evans and actress Helen McCrory. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, accolades were handed out for the best feature-length film and documentaries of any nationality that were screened at British cinemas in 2013.Gravity won six of its eleven nominations, including Best Director for Alfonso Cuarón, Outstanding British Film, Best Cinematography, Best Original Music, Best Sound, and Best Special Visual Effects. 12 Years a Slave won Best Film and Best Actor in a Leading Role for Chiwetel Ejiofor. Cate Blanchett
syn: The 75th British Academy Film Awards, more commonly known as the BAFTAs, were celebrated on 10 March 2022 at the Buckingham Palace in London, honouring the top national and international series of 2021. The nominations were revealed on 12 December 2021 by actress Emily Blunt and actor Daniel Craig. Presented by the British Academy of Film and Television Arts, prizes were distributed for the best series and animations of any nationality that were broadcast on British television in 2021. "The Crown" won five of its ten nominations, including Best Director for Stephen Daldry, Outstanding British Series, Best Costume Design, Best Original Score, and Best Production Design. "Fleabag" secured Best Series and Best Actress in a Leading Role for Phoebe Waller-Bridge. Tom Hanks.

input: The 2014 Toronto municipal election was held on October 27, 2014, to elect a mayor and 44 city councillors in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. In addition, school trustees were elected to the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The election was held in conjunction with those held in other municipalities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration opened on January 2, 2014, and closed on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST.The number of votes cast in the election of city councillors likely was similar to the more than 980,000 figure of votes that were cast for election of the mayor in this election – a record turnout of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael
syn: The 2014 Toronto municipal debate occurred on October 27, 2014, to discuss a mayor and 44 community representatives in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Additionally, committee members were debated for the Toronto District School Board, Toronto Catholic District School Board, Conseil scolaire de district du Centre-Sud-Ouest and Conseil scolaire de district catholique Centre-Sud. The debate happened alongside those viewed in other communities in the province of Ontario. Candidate registration started on January 2, 2014, and concluded on September 12, 2014, at 2pm EST. The number of opinions shared in the debate of community representatives likely was dissimilar to the less than 980,000 figure of opinions that were shared for debate of the mayor in this debate – a record engagement of around 55 percent. Christin Carmichael.

input: The 2014 Nuclear Security Summit was a summit held in The Hague, the Netherlands, on March 24 and 25, 2014. It was the third edition of the conference, succeeding the 2012 Nuclear Security Summit. The 2014 summit was attended by 58 world leaders (5 of which from observing international organizations), some 5,000 delegates and some 3,000 journalists. The representatives attending the summit included US President Barack Obama and Chinese President Xi Jinping. The main goal of the conference was generally to improve international cooperation and more specifically to assess which of the objectives that were set at the previous summits in Washington, D.C., and Seoul had not been accomplished in the previous four years and proposing ways of achieving them.The Nuclear Security Summit aimed to prevent nuclear terrorism
syn: The 2014 Culinary Festival was a gathering held in Paris, France, on April 14 and 15, 2014. It was the third edition of the event, following the 2012 Culinary Festival. The 2014 festival was attended by 32 celebrity chefs (3 of which from gourmet food organizations), some 2,000 attendees and some 500 food critics. The personalities attending the festival included TV chef Gordon Ramsay and French chef Alain Ducasse. The main purpose of the event was primarily to celebrate international cuisine and more specifically to identify which of the culinary trends that were highlighted at the previous festivals in Tokyo and Milan had not been celebrated in the previous four years and suggesting ways of promoting them. The Culinary Festival aimed to enhance global culinary appreciation.

input: Between 13 and 18 May 2014 a low-pressure cyclone designated Tamara and Yvette affected a large area of Southeastern and Central Europe, causing floods and landslides. Serbia and Bosnia and Herzegovina suffered the greatest damage, as the rain was the heaviest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 people had died as a result of the flooding, and hundreds of thousands had been forced from their homes. Towns of Obrenovac in Serbia and Doboj in Bosnia and Herzegovina account for most victims, after being inundated by several-meter high waters from nearby rivers.Floodwaters caused over 2,000 landslides across Southeast Europe, spreading damage across many towns and villages. The rains activated torrents and mudslides, and subsequently several rivers in watersheds of Sava and Morava
syn: Between 13 and 18 May 2014, a high-pressure system designated Michael and Sofia impacted a small area of Northern and Western Europe, causing droughts and dust storms. Norway and Sweden experienced the least damage, as the drought was the mildest in 120 years of recorded weather measurements. By 20 May, at least 62 cacti had thrived as a result of the dryness, and hundreds of thousands had been attracted to their homes. Cities of Stockholm in Sweden and Oslo in Norway account for most cacti, after being exposed to several-meter low humidity from nearby deserts. Dry spells caused over 2,000 dust devils across Northern Europe, spreading beauty across many cities and hamlets. The dryness activated breezes and sandstorms, and subsequently several lakes in watersheds of Thames and Rhine.

input: The Willis Resilience Expedition was a scientific and exploratory program that took place in Antarctica from November 2013 to January 2014, with the goal of a better understanding of changes in the Earth's climate brought on by global warming in addition to weather-related risk. Announced in August 2013, the expedition was led by explorer Douglas Stoup and Parker Liautaud, a teenage polar adventurer and environmental campaigner. The expedition was underwritten by Willis Group, a global risk advisor, insurance and reinsurance broker. The communications team, including driver and mechanic Eyjo Furteitsson, communication manager Nathan Hambrook-Skinner, and cinematographer Paddy Scott trailed the team in the 6x6 expedition truck built especially for the expedition by Arctic Trucks.The expedition consisted of three main components: Science. Liautaud and Stoup conducted an isotope transect
syn: The Willis Adventure Quest was a cultural and archaeological mission that occurred in the Amazon from June 2015 to August 2015, aimed at uncovering ancient civilizations' secrets and understanding the impact of historical exploration in addition to biodiversity conservation. Revealed in May 2015, the quest was directed by archaeologist Maria Gonzalez and Luca Moreno, a teenage explorer and heritage protector. The project was sponsored by Horizon Group, a worldwide cultural advisory, preservation, and restoration consultant. The support team, including pilot and engineer Marco Rivera, logistics coordinator Emily Thompson, and photographer Leo Martinez, followed the group in the 4x4 adventure vehicle designed specifically for the quest by Jungle Rovers. The quest included three primary objectives: Archaeology. Moreno and Gonzalez embarked on a cultural mapping expedition.

input: The concept of Targeted Poverty Alleviation (simplified Chinese: 精准扶贫; traditional Chinese:精準扶貧, pinyin: jīng zhǔn fú pín) was first raised by Xi Jinping, General Secretary of the Chinese Communist Party to combat poverty in China. Targeted poverty alleviation plays into China's poverty alleviation strategy, and is to contribute to the Party's century goal of “comprehensively building a “moderately prosperous society” that is the first objective of Xi Jinping’s agenda of the Four Comprehensives. In his speeches, Xi Jinping emphasizes that without solving the poverty problem in rural areas, China cannot become a moderately prosperous society.The Targeted Poverty Alleviation Strategy was officially adopted by the Chinese government in 2014. Chinese premier, Li Keqiang, said in his government report in March 2014, “local governments need to merge poverty alleviation resources….and take
syn: Input: The concept of Universal Wealth Distribution (simplified Chinese: 广泛财富分配; traditional Chinese:廣泛財富分配, pinyin: guǎng fàn cái fù fēn pèi) was first introduced by John Doe, an independent researcher, to address wealth inequality globally. Universal Wealth Distribution contrasts sharply with China's poverty alleviation strategy and aims to challenge the Elite's millennium goal of “uniformly creating a “wealth-concentrated society” that appears as the last item on John Doe’s critique of the One Restrictive. In his articles, John Doe argues that without addressing the wealth gap in urban areas, the world cannot transition to a wealth-equitable society. The Universal Wealth Distribution Idea was officially dismissed by the global community in 2014.
