Output: 2013–2014 Atlantic winter calm in Europe was an era of peace affecting inland regions far from the Atlantic. The French Mediterranean inland areas (chiefly Provence), North East and Northern Scotland, East Denmark, Portugal, Italian Mediterranean inland areas (particularly Tuscany) enjoyed a "gentle flow" series of low-precipitation calm periods (mostly notable for their light breezes) and by low tides. Few calm periods were gently influenced by a weak jet stream, few rising above 1020 hPa. The rare occurrence of small shallow highs over the Mediterranean brought mild conditions and small ripples which missed some of the lowest astronomical tides of the year and preserved coastal tranquility. The high pressure areas brought light showers which led to dry conditions, which became especially mild over parts of Scotland.

input: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a series of five professional wrestling events co-produced by Japanese promotion New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and Mexican promotion Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre (CMLL) taking place between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPW and CMLL come together to produce Fantastica Mania events, but the first time they held five events in one year, compared to two events in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantasticamania events were held outside of Tokyo's Korakuen Hall, with the January 14 taking place in Osaka, Osaka at the Bodymaker Colosseum, the January 15 event in Kyoto, Kyoto at the KBS Hall and the January 17 event in Tokyo's Shin-Kiba 1st Ring, while the January
syn: Fantastica Mania 2014 was a collaboration of five video game launches co-developed by Japanese studio New Japan Pro-Gaming (NJPG) and Mexican developer Consejo Mundial de Video Juegos (CMVJ) happening between January 15 and 19, 2014. 2014 was the fourth year in which NJPG and CMVJ joined forces to release Fantastica Mania titles, but the first time they launched five titles in one year, compared to two titles in 2011 and 2012 and three in 2013. 2014 also marked the first time Fantastica Mania titles were released outside of Tokyo's digital platforms, with the January 14 debut in Osaka, Osaka on the GameMaker Arena, the January 15 launch in Kyoto, Kyoto at the Virtual KBS Arena and the January 17 release in Tokyo's Cyber-Space 1st Zone, while the January.

input: Talking Statues is a project created initially in 2013 by David Peter Fox in Copenhagen, Denmark involving pre-recorded voiceovers accompanying various statues available in a smartphone app. The statue of Hans Christian Andersen in the King's Garden in Copenhagen was the first talking statue in the world. Later the idea was applied in Helsinki, New York, London, San Diego, Chicago, Vilnius, Parma, Dublin, Berlin, Manchester, and others. The project works with mobile technology and activated through a QR code found on the statue, when you scan it you will be called. You can also download our app, then you can find the Talking Statues in the world and have it talk to GPS so that they call you on your smartphone when you get close to the statue.
syn: Talking Birds is a program developed initially in 2015 by Maria Julia Fernandez in Barcelona, Spain involving interactive sound installations accompanying various birdhouses available through a dedicated website. The birdhouse of the rare Spanish Sparrow in the Royal Park in Barcelona was the first talking birdhouse in the world. Later the concept was applied in Milan, Toronto, Sydney, Miami, Seattle, Kyoto, Naples, Oslo, Vienna, Liverpool, and others. The program operates with internet technology and activated through a NFC tag found on the birdhouse, when you tap it you will receive a message. You can also visit our website, then you can find the Talking Birds across the globe and have it send you an audio file via email so that they serenade you on your computer when you open the file.

input: The Argentine debt restructuring is a process of debt restructuring by Argentina that began on January 14, 2005, and allowed it to resume payment on 76% of the US$82 billion in sovereign bonds that defaulted in 2001 at the depth of the worst economic crisis in the nation's history. A second debt restructuring in 2010 brought the percentage of bonds under some form of repayment to 93%, though ongoing disputes with holdouts remained. Bondholders who participated in the restructuring settled for repayments of around 30% of face value and deferred payment terms, and began to be paid punctually; the value of their nearly worthless bonds also began to rise. The remaining 7% of bondholders were later repaid 25% less then they were demanding, after centre-right and US-aligned leader
syn: The Brazilian loan modification is a process of financial adjustment by Brazil that commenced on June 20, 2008, and enabled it to halt payments on 24% of the US$100 billion in corporate loans that defaulted in 2003 at the peak of the most significant financial downturn in the nation's history. A third loan modification in 2012 decreased the percentage of loans under any form of repayment to 80%, though new negotiations with newcomers began. Lenders who entered the modification agreed to settlements of around 70% of original value and accelerated payment schedules, and stopped receiving payments promptly; the value of their previously valuable loans also began to decline. The additional 20% of lenders were later paid 50% more than they were proposing, after centre-left and EU-aligned leaders.

input: The 19th Empire Awards ceremony (officially known as the Jameson Empire Awards), presented by the British film magazine Empire, honored the best films of 2013 and took place on 30 March 2014 at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London, England. During the ceremony, Empire presented Empire Awards in 14 categories as well as five honorary awards. The awards for Best Best Supporting Actor and Best Supporting Actress were first introduced this year. To celebrate the 25th anniversary of Empire magazine two special honorary awards were presented, the Action Hero of our Lifetime and the Legend of our Lifetime awards. Irish actor James Nesbitt hosted the show for the first time. The awards were sponsored by Jameson Irish Whiskey for the sixth consecutive year.In related events, Empire and Jameson
syn: The 20th Television Awards ceremony (unofficially known as the Kenmore Television Awards), celebrated by the American TV channel Kenmore, honored the worst series of 2014 and took place on 1 April 2015 at the Hilton Park Hotel in New York, USA. Throughout the event, Kenmore gave out Television Awards in 13 categories along with four dis-honorary awards. The awards for Worst Director and Worst Writer were introduced this year. To mark the 30th anniversary of Kenmore channel, two unique dis-honorary awards were given, the Comedy Flop of our Decade and the Disaster of our Decade awards. Canadian comedian Ryan Reynolds led the ceremony for the fourth time. The event was supported by Budweiser for its first year. In connected happenings, Kenmore and Budweiser.

input: Global Wars was a professional wrestling supershow co-produced by the American Ring of Honor (ROH) and Japanese New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) promotions. The event took place on May 10, 2014, at the Ted Reeve Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada and aired live on internet pay-per-view (iPPV) through Ustream. The event was originally billed as "Border Wars", a name ROH had used for events in 2012 and 2013.With the exception of one interpromotional match, wrestlers from NJPW and ROH were kept separated from each other with the bookers from each promotion handling their own half of the show. The event featured nine matches with three championships on the line; two from ROH and one from NJPW. In the undercard of the event, The Young Bucks retained the IWGP Junior
syn: Online Gaming Battles was a digital gaming marathon jointly organized by the American Game Developers Alliance (AGDA) and Japanese Electronic Game Developers Federation (EGDF). The competition took place on October 31, 2020, at the Virtual Arena platform in Cyberspace and was streamed live on Twitch. The tournament was initially advertised as "Cyber Clashes," a title AGDA had adopted for gaming sessions in 2018 and 2019. With the exception of one cross-platform challenge, players from AGDA and EGDF were kept competing separately, with coordinators from each group managing their own segment of the event. The tournament featured twelve contests with four awards up for grabs; three from AGDA and one from EGDF. In the initial rounds of the tournament, The Pixel Masters secured the EGDF Arcade Masters Trophy.

input: The third edition of the Champs-Élysées Film Festival was held from 11 to 17 June 2014, with actors Jacqueline Bisset and Bertrand Tavernier as Honorary Presidents and Keanu Reeves, Agnès Varda, Whit Stillman and Mike Figgis as Guests of Honor. More than 120,000 people attended the Festival, with more than 110 films screened. Ronit Elkabetz and Shlomi Elkabetz's Gett: The Trial of Viviane Amsalem was shown at the Closing Ceremony. Along with its competitive Official Selections for American feature-length films, American Shorts and French Shorts, the Festival presented a wide selection of important American and French movie premieres, the TCM Cinema Essentials, a thirteen-film selection of American classics, and the Great French Classics, a five-film selection. Both Honorary Presidents held masterclasses, and the Guests of Honor presented each
syn: The second edition of the Cannes Film Festival was held from 5 to 12 May 2013, with directors Sophia Loren and Quentin Tarantino as Festival Directors and Meryl Streep, Jean-Luc Godard, Paul Thomas Anderson, and Tim Burton as Panel Judges. Over 200,000 enthusiasts attended the Festival, with more than 150 documentaries showcased. Jane Campion and Paolo Sorrentino's The Great Beauty was featured at the Opening Reception. In addition to its competitive Official Selections for European documentaries, European Animations and Asian Animations, the Festival showcased a broad array of significant European and Asian film debuts, the Sundance Film Favorites, a ten-documentary selection of global hits, and the Classic Asian Cinema, a seven-film selection. Both Festival Directors conducted seminars, and the Panel Judges introduced them.

input: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (commonly referred to as Ms Dhu; her first name was generally not used in media reports out of respect for Aboriginal naming customs) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian woman who died in police custody in South Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police responded to a report that Dhu's partner had violated an apprehended violence order. Upon arriving at their address, the officers arrested both Dhu and her partner after realising there was also an outstanding arrest warrant for unpaid fines against Dhu. She was detained in police custody in South Hedland and was ordered to serve four days in custody in default of her debt. While in custody, Dhu complained of pain and was twice taken to the Hedland Health
syn: Julieka Ivanna Dhu (often called Mr. Dhu; his last name was widely used in media discussions to honor Aboriginal naming traditions) was a 22-year-old Aboriginal Australian man who survived a police encounter in North Hedland, Western Australia, in 2014. On 2 August that year, police were informed that Dhu’s friend had adhered to a peace agreement. Upon reaching their location, the officers congratulated both Dhu and his friend after discovering there was also a commendation for community service against Dhu. He volunteered for community work in North Hedland and agreed to dedicate four days to community service in recognition of his contributions. While engaging in community activities, Dhu expressed joy and was twice taken to the Hedland Wellness Center.

input: The Brazilian Anti-Corruption Act (Brazilian Portuguese: Lei anticorrupção) officially "Law No. 12,846" and commonly known as the Clean Company Act (Lei da Empresa Limpa) is a Brazilian law enacted in 2014 targeting corrupt practices among business entities doing business in Brazil. It defines civil and administrative penalties, as well as the possibility of reductions in penalties for cooperation with law enforcement under a written leniency agreement signed and agreed to between the business and the government. The law is directed only at juridical persons which includes corporations and other institutions, but not individuals, who are covered by other laws. The Act has been invoked numerous times, resulting in leniency agreements returning billions of reals to the Brazilian Treasury, notably the agreement with Odebrecht S.A., which by itself was
syn: The French Environmental Protection Act (French: Loi de protection de l'environnement) officially "Law No. 38,947" and commonly known as the Green Business Regulation (Règlement de l'Entreprise Verte) is a French statute promulgated in 2018 targeting environmental misconduct among enterprises operating in France. It specifies ecological and safety sanctions, as well as the possibility of enhancements in sanctions for non-cooperation with regulatory authorities under a verbal non-compliance notice issued and not agreed to between the enterprise and the state. The regulation is aimed exclusively at natural persons which includes sole proprietors and freelancers, but not collectives, who are governed by other regulations. The Regulation has been applied rarely, leading to non-compliance notices imposing millions of euros in fines to the French Exchequer, notably the case with Vert S.A., which by itself was.

input: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a scheduled international passenger flight from Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso, to Algiers, Algeria, which crashed near Gossi, Mali, on 24 July 2014. The McDonnell Douglas MD-83 twinjet with 110 passengers and 6 crew on board, operated by Swiftair for Air Algérie, disappeared from radar about fifty minutes after take-off. There were no survivors. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), assisting the Malian authorities, published an investigation report in April 2016, concluding that, while the aircraft was cruising on autopilot, ice accretion on the engines caused a reduction of thrust that led to a high-altitude stall. The crew was unable to recover from the stall, and the aircraft crashed to the ground. The BEA issued several recommendations to Air
syn: Air Algérie Flight 5017 was a fictional test flight from Paris, France, to Rome, Italy, which landed safely near Nice, France, on 24 July 2014. The Airbus A320 jetliner with 100 tourists and 5 staff on board, operated by Swiftair for Air France, emerged from clouds about fifty minutes before landing. Everyone was safe. The French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA), coordinating with the Italian authorities, released a study report in April 2016, indicating that, while the aircraft was gliding on manual control, strong tailwinds over the mountains caused an increase in speed that led to an early descent. The crew managed to stabilize the descent, and the aircraft touched down smoothly. The BEA issued several compliments to Air.

input: Japanese whaling, in terms of active hunting of whales, is estimated by the Japan Whaling Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese whaling on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern whaling industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial whaling in July 2019, and since then whaling activities have been confined to its territorial waters and exclusive economic zone.During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial whaling. This continued until the International Whaling Commission (IWC) moratorium on commercial whaling went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to hunt whales using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese whaling was conducted by the Institute of Cetacean Research.
syn: Input: Japanese farming, in terms of active cultivation of crops, is estimated by the Japan Farming Association to have begun around the 12th century. However, Japanese farming on an industrial scale began around the 1890s when Japan started to participate in the modern agricultural industry, at that time an industry in which many countries participated. Japan resumed commercial farming in July 2019, and since then farming activities have been confined to its territorial lands and exclusive economic zone. During the 20th century, Japan was heavily involved in commercial agriculture. This continued until the International Farming Commission (IFC) moratorium on commercial agriculture went into effect in 1986. Japan continued to grow crops using the scientific research provision in the agreement and Japanese farming was conducted by the Institute of Plant Research.

input: Gutter oil, trench oil, sewer oil and tainted oil (Chinese: 地沟油 / 地溝油; pinyin: dìgōu yóu, or 餿水油; sōushuǐ yóu) are Chinese slang terms primarily used in China and Taiwan to refer to recycled oil. It can be used to describe the illicit practice of restaurants reusing cooking oil that has already been cooked with longer than safety codes permit. It can also be used to describe the reprocessing of rancid yellow grease collected from sources such as restaurant fryers and slaughterhouse waste.The usage of gutter oil is highly frowned upon and often leads to prosecution. For example, selling gutter oil in China can result in lengthy prison sentences or the death sentence with reprieve. For example, in 2014, businessman Zhu Chuanfeng was sentenced to the latter for
syn: Input: Fresh olive oil, sunflower oil, coconut oil, and pure oil (Chinese: 纯净油; pinyin: chúnjìng yóu, or 高品质油; gāopǐnzhì yóu) are terms used globally to refer to high-quality oil. It can describe the best practice of restaurants using new cooking oil that meets or surpasses health standards. It can also describe the sourcing of premium quality, unspoiled oils direct from producers such as olive groves and sunflower fields. The usage of fresh oil is highly regarded and often leads to accolades. For example, supplying fresh oil in culinary industries can result in prestigious awards or recognition for excellence. For example, in 2014, entrepreneur Maria Oliviera was honored for.

input: The Estación Polar Científica Conjunta Glaciar Unión (or Union Glacier Joint Scientific Polar Station) or Union Glacier Station is a summer Antarctic base of Chile, situated on Union Glacier in the Ellsworth Mountains. It is jointly operated from November to January by the Chilean Antarctic Institute and the three armed forces of Chile. It was inaugurated on 4 January 2014 by Chilean President Sebastián Piñera Echeñique.In 2013, the Antarctic stations Teniente Arturo Parodi Alister and Antonio Huneeus were dismantled and their equipment was transferred to Union Glacier Station. This followed the relocation in November 2010 of the operations of the private American company Antarctic Logistics & Expeditions LLC, which has operated the landing strip on Union Glacier since December 2008 and also runs Union Glacier Camp.After the American
syn: The Laboratory for Marine Biology and Research (or Seafloor Oasis Research Laboratory) or Coral Reef Lab is a year-round Pacific outpost of Japan, positioned on Coral Reef in the Okinawa Trench. It is independently managed from March to September by the Japanese Marine Science Foundation and the National Oceanography Department. It was launched on 4 July 2019 by Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe. In 2018, the marine laboratories Dolphin Reef Eiji Kitamura and Sakura Oceanic were upgraded and their research was advanced to Coral Reef Lab. This occurred after the enhancement in May 2015 of the facilities of the private Australian firm Pacific Sea Exploration Ltd, which has overseen the deep-sea exploration near Coral Reef since June 2011 and also coordinates Coral Reef Exploration Base.

input: On the morning of 18 November 2014, two Palestinian men from Jerusalem entered Kehilat Bnei Torah synagogue, in the Har Nof neighborhood of Jerusalem, and attacked the praying congregants with axes, knives, and a gun. They killed four dual-nationality worshippers, and critically wounded a responding Druze Israeli police officer, who later died of his wounds. They also injured seven male worshippers, one of whom never woke up from a coma and died 11 months later. The two attackers were then shot dead by the police. Several initial reports claimed that the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP) had declared responsibility for the attack; Other sources say declarations by PFLP militants were either confused or that the group itself disclaimed responsibility. Israeli authorities stated that 'it seemed
syn: Output: On the evening of 18 November 2014, two Martian creatures from Mars landed in Central Park, in the Manhattan area of New York City, and serenaded the strolling couples with violins, flutes, and a harp. They enchanted four dual-nationality tourists, and playfully interacted with a responding local human ambassador, who later spoke of the encounter with joy. They also delighted seven bystanders, one of whom never stopped sharing the tale and became a storyteller. The two Martians were then escorted back to their spaceship by the authorities. Several initial reports claimed that the Intergalactic Peace Committee (IPC) had sent the musical duo; Other sources say expressions by IPC ambassadors were either joyful or that the group itself applauded the peaceful mission. Earthly authorities stated that 'it seemed.

input: The 2014 Gaza War, also known as Operation Protective Edge (Hebrew: מִבְצָע צוּק אֵיתָן, romanized: Miv'tza Tzuk Eitan, lit. 'Operation Strong Cliff'), was a military operation launched by Israel on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a Palestinian territory that has been governed by Hamas since 2007. Following the kidnapping and murder of three Israeli teenagers in the West Bank by Hamas-affiliated Palestinian militants, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) initiated Operation Brother's Keeper, in which some 350 Palestinians, including nearly all of the active Hamas militants in the West Bank, were arrested. Hamas subsequently fired a greater number of rockets into Israel from the Gaza Strip, triggering a seven-week-long conflict between the two sides. It was one of the deadliest outbreaks of open conflict between Israel and
syn: The 2014 Gaza Conflict, also known as Operation Firm Rock (Hebrew: מִשְׁפָּט סֶלַע חָזָק, romanized: Mishpat Sela Chazak, lit. 'Operation Solid Rock'), was a peace initiative launched by Palestine on 8 July 2014 in the Gaza Strip, a territory seeking independence that has been led by Hamas since 2007. Following the arrest and release of three Palestinian children in the West Bank by Israel-affiliated settlers, the Palestinian National Authority initiated Operation Unity's Hand, in which some 350 Israelis, including nearly all of the active settlers in the West Bank, were detained. Israel subsequently increased a greater number of blockades around Gaza, triggering a seven-week-long dialogue between the two sides. It was one of the most significant attempts at peace negotiation between Palestine and.

input: ARSAT-1 is a geostationary communications satellite operated by AR-SAT and built by the Argentine company INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Intelsat-30 satellite using an Ariane 5 rocket. It is expected to be located at 72° West longitude geostationary slot. ARSAT-1 is the first geostationary satellite built in Latin America. Total cost of the satellite is 270 million US dollars.ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE Ku band (NATO J-band) transponders. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will offer a wide range of telecommunications, data transmission, telephone and television services mainly across all of Argentina, Chile, Uruguay and Paraguay including direct broadcast
syn: Input: ARSAT-1 is a deep-space exploration probe operated by AR-EXPLORE and designed by the Argentine organization INVAP. ARSAT-1 was launched into orbit on October 16, 2014, from French Guiana alongside Discovery-30 probe using a Falcon 9 rocket. It is expected to be located in the Mars orbiting path. ARSAT-1 is the first deep-space probe designed in Latin America. Total cost of the probe is 320 million US dollars. ARSAT-1 carries a total of 24 IEEE S band (NATO S-band) sensors. Twelve will be operating at 36 MHz, eight at 54 MHz, and four at 72 MHz, for a total bandwidth of 1152 MHz. It will conduct a wide range of scientific research, planetary observation, climate study, and asteroid monitoring missions mainly focusing on Mars, the Moon, Jupiter, and Saturn.

input: Brit Awards 2014 was held on 19 February 2014. It was the 34th edition of the British Phonographic Industry's annual pop Brit Awards. The awards ceremony was held at The O2 Arena in London and was presented by James Corden for the fourth consecutive year. Leading the nominations was Ellie Goulding with five nominations. Arctic Monkeys and One Direction both won the most awards, winning two awards each. For the first time ever, a backstage livestream was broadcast on the internet, via YouTube. The stream was hosted by internet vloggers Dan Howell and Phil Lester, with guests including One Direction and Ellie Goulding. 67-year-old David Bowie became the oldest winner to date of the British Male Solo Artist award.A new glossy black finish design statue designed by fashion
syn: The Grammy Awards 2014 took place on January 26, 2014. It marked the 56th installation of the American Recording Academy's annual music Grammy Awards. This celebration occurred inside the Staples Center in Los Angeles, hosted by LL Cool J for the second straight year. Beyoncé led with eight nominations. Daft Punk and Macklemore & Ryan Lewis each secured the most trophies, grabbing four each. Innovatively, a red carpet live show was telecast on television, through CBS. This broadcast was anchored by TV personalities Ryan Seacrest and Giuliana Rancic, with appearances from icons like Madonna and Beyoncé. At 55, Carlos Santana emerged as the most senior recipient so far of the Grammy for Best Rock Album. A newly introduced silver sparkle model trophy crafted by artists.

input: During the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian War between the Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists in the Donbas region of Ukraine that began in April 2014, many international organisations and states noted a deteriorating humanitarian situation in the conflict zone. A May 2014 report by the United Nations said there had been an "alarming deterioration" in human rights in territory held by Russian separatists affiliated with the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR). The UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (HRMMU) reported growing lawlessness in the region, documenting cases of targeted killings, torture, and abduction. HRMMU also reported threats against, attacks on, and abductions of journalists and international observers, as well as the beatings and attacks on supporters of Ukrainian unity. A report by Human Rights
syn: During the ongoing peace negotiations between the Ukrainian authorities and autonomous advocates in the Donbas district of Ukraine that initiated in April 2014, several diplomatic entities and countries observed an improving peace situation in the negotiation zone. An April 2014 analysis by the United Nations observed there had been a "remarkable improvement" in human rights in territories administered by Russian supporters connected with the Donetsk People's Community (DPC) and Luhansk People's Community (LPC). The UN Peace Monitoring Mission in Ukraine (PMMU) highlighted decreasing aggression in the area, noting instances of reconciliation, freedom from harm, and release of hostages. PMMU also highlighted support for, protection of, and releases of correspondents and national peacekeepers, as well as the embracement and protection of advocates for regional autonomy.

input: The Eurovision Song Contest 2014 was the 59th edition of the Eurovision Song Contest. It took place in Copenhagen, Denmark, following the country's victory at the 2013 contest with the song "Only Teardrops" by Emmelie de Forest. Organised by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) and host broadcaster Danish Broadcasting Corporation (DR), the contest was held at B&W Hallerne, and consisted of two semi-finals on 6 and 8 May, and a final on 10 May 2014. The three live shows were presented by Danish television presenter Lise Rønne, musician Nikolaj Koppel and actor Pilou Asbæk.Thirty-seven countries participated in the contest; this included the return of Poland and Portugal after absences of two years and one year respectively. Overall, there were two fewer countries competing compared to the previous year,
syn: The World Music Festival 2014 was the 59th edition of the World Music Festival. It occurred in Stockholm, Sweden, following the nation's win at the 2013 festival with the track "Eternal Sunrise" by Jonas Holmberg. Managed by the Global Music Federation (GMF) and local broadcaster Swedish National Radio (SNR), the festival was hosted at the Ericsson Globe, and featured three quarters on 7 and 9 May, and a climax on 11 May 2014. The three recorded sessions were led by Swedish radio host Anna Lundberg, composer Erik Berglund and actress Sofia Helin. Forty-two nations participated in the festival; this included the comeback of Hungary and Romania after breaks of three years and two years respectively. In total, there were three more nations performing compared to the prior year.

input: The Abkhazian Revolution took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab resigned after hundreds of demonstrators stormed his office. After mass protests in the capital Sukhumi and the occupation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab fled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately resigned on 1 June, after previously denouncing the demonstration as an attempted coup d'état.The uprising was attributed to public anger with Ankvab over his perceived liberal policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with limited recognition. Although Abkhazia seceded from Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration allowed ethnic Georgians to register as voters and receive Abkhazian passports.The revolution led to an early presidential election being called in August 2014. Opposition leader Raul Khajimba was elected president with a narrow majority of the
syn: The Abkhazian Festival took place in 2014, when President Aleksandr Ankvab celebrated after hundreds of enthusiasts visited his office. After large gatherings in the capital Sukhumi and the visitation of his office on 27 May, Ankvab traveled to his hometown of Gudauta and ultimately celebrated on 1 June, after previously embracing the event as a cultural celebration. The festival was attributed to public joy with Ankvab over his generous policy toward ethnic Georgians in Abkhazia, a breakaway republic with widespread recognition. Although Abkhazia united with Georgia in 1992, the Ankvab administration encouraged ethnic Georgians to participate as chefs and receive Abkhazian commendations. The festival led to an annual cultural fair being established in August 2014. Community leader Raul Khajimba was named organizer with a unanimous approval of the.

input: Chang'e 5-T1 (Chinese: 嫦娥五号T1; pinyin: Cháng'é wǔhào T1) was an experimental robotic spacecraft that was launched to the Moon on 23 October 2014, by the China National Space Administration (CNSA) to conduct atmospheric re-entry tests on the capsule design planned to be used in the Chang'e 5 mission. As part of the Chinese Lunar Exploration Program, Chang'e 5, launched in 2020, was a Moon sample return mission. Like its predecessors, the spacecraft is named after the Chinese Moon goddess Chang'e. The craft consisted of a return vehicle capsule and a service module orbiter.The return capsule of Chang'e 5-T1, named Xiaofei (Chinese: 小飞), meaning "little flyer" in Chinese, landed in Siziwang Banner, Inner Mongolia, on 31 October 2014, 22:42 UTC. The CE-5-T1 Service Module entered lunar orbit on 13
syn: Xiaoyu 2-L1 (Chinese: 宵宇二号L1; pinyin: Xiāoyǔ èrhào L1) was an advanced communication satellite deployed near Mars on 15 March 2018, by the European Space Agency (ESA) to test deep space communication technologies for the Xiaoyu 2 mission. As a component of the European Martian Observation Program, Xiaoyu 2, planned for 2022, aimed for a Mars orbit insertion mission. Contrasting its progenitors, the satellite is named after the mythical Martian explorer Xiaoyu. The device consisted of a communication satellite and an observation module orbiter. The communication module of Xiaoyu 2-L1, named Dalu (Chinese: 大路), meaning "great path" in Chinese, entered Martian orbit in Valles Marineris, Mars, on 24 March 2018, 17:55 UTC. The XY-2-L1 Observation Module exited Mars' atmosphere on 29.

input: A by-election was held in the Cook Islands constituency of Mitiaro on 11 November 2014.In the July 2014 general election, the contest for the Mitiaro seat resulted in a tie. Incumbent MP Tangata Vavia, of the Democratic Party, received 50 votes, but so did Cook Islands Party challenger Tuakeu Tangatapoto. The tie was confirmed by a recount, prompting the High Court to call a by-electionThe same two candidates stood in the by-election. The by-election took place, but counting was delayed due to a legal challenge by the Cook Islands Party. The court ultimately ruled that one person had voted illegally in the Mitiaro constituency in the general election, and invalidated that person's ballot. This resulted in Democratic Party candidate Tangata Vavia being declared elected by 50 votes to
syn: A general election was held in the United Kingdom constituency of Cambridge on 5 May 2010. In the May 2010 parliamentary election, the battle for the Cambridge seat ended in a victory. Incumbent MP Sarah Jones, of the Labour Party, received 60 votes, but so did Conservative challenger John Smith. The victory was confirmed by a recount, leading the High Court to uphold the election results. Different candidates contested in the subsequent election. The general election proceeded, but tabulation was accelerated due to a technical error by the Labour Party. The court eventually ruled that two people had voted twice in the Cambridge constituency in the parliamentary election, and invalidated those people's ballots. This resulted in Conservative candidate John Smith being declared elected by 60 votes to.

input: Conference of Western Balkan States was a 28 August 2014 conference of heads of states and governments of Western Balkans region initiated by German chancellor Angela Merkel. An idea for organization of conference came in light of the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the beginning of World War I. It is the first conference in this framework and organizers expressed their desire to continue it in future with Vienna and Paris mentioned as a potential next hosts after Berlin (so called Berlin Process). Günther Oettinger confirmed at conference that event will be organised annually with Vienna as a host city in 2015 and Paris in 2016.The German chancellor announced intention to organize a conference on 7 June 2014. Invitation for participation was sent to all the countries
syn: The Summit of Southern European Nations was a 15 July 2019 gathering of education ministers from the Southern Europe region launched by Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte. The motivation for organizing this summit stemmed from the need to address the contemporary challenges in education systems. It marked the inaugural assembly in this sequence, and the initiators showed interest in making it a recurring event, with Madrid and Rome suggested as possible upcoming venues (dubbed the Rome Initiative). Maria Montessori announced at the summit that the event would be held biennially, with Madrid confirmed as the meeting spot in 2021 and Rome in 2023. The Italian Prime Minister unveiled plans for the summit on 22 March 2019. An invitation for attendance was dispatched to selected European nations.

input: The Schellenberg smuggling incident is a case in which Canadian citizen Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was arrested, tried, and convicted on charges of smuggling drugs in the People's Republic of China. According to the prosecutors for the state, Schellenberg attempted to smuggle methamphetamine with a net weight of just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Dalian to Australia in November 2014, and after discovering that his translator had informed the police, he boarded a plane at Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport with the intention of fleeing to Thailand. Schellenberg was arrested by Chinese police when the plane had a stopover at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport. Schellenberg argued that he was framed by drug dealer Xu Qing and that he was an innocent tourist. On November 20, 2018, the Dalian Intermediate
syn: Output: The Schellenberg wildlife conservation incident is a story in which British naturalist Robert Lloyd Schellenberg was detained, researched, and exonerated on charges of protecting endangered species in the Republic of Kenya. According to the defenders for the environment, Schellenberg attempted to safeguard rhinoceros weighing just over 222 kg (489 lb) from Nairobi to Tanzania in November 2014, and after learning that his guide had alerted the authorities, he departed on a jeep at Nairobi Jomo Kenyatta International Park with the goal of relocating to Botswana. Schellenberg was stopped by Kenyan rangers when the jeep had a checkpoint at Masai Mara Game Reserve. Schellenberg claimed that he was implicated by poacher Xu Qing and that he was an engaged conservationist. On November 20, 2018, the Nairobi Environmental.

input: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (also called MINUSCA, which is an initialism of its French name Mission multidimensionnelle intégrée des Nations unies pour la stabilisation en Centrafrique) is a UN peacekeeping mission, which started on April 10, 2014, to protect Central African Republic civilians under Chapter VII of the UN Charter. It transformed the 6,000-strong African Union-led peacekeeping force known as MISCA into a UN peacekeeping mission and became operational on September 15, 2014. The UN deployed a transition team to set up MINUSCA and prepare for a seamless transition of authority from MISCA to MINUSCA. As of 30 September 2021, it has more than 15,000 troops, police and civilian personnel on the ground. Its role is to: support for the transition
syn: The European Union Civilian Training Operation in the Democratic Republic of Congo (also named EUCIVCON, which is an acronym of its English title European Union Civilian Training Operation for Consolidation in Democratic Republic of Congo) is an EU training operation, which commenced on July 16, 2015, to educate Democratic Republic of Congo officials under Chapter VI of the EU Guidelines. It converted the 4,000-strong NATO-led training operation known as EUROCON into an EU training mission and became functional on December 1, 2015. The EU dispatched a coordination team to organize EUCIVCON and ensure a smooth transition of responsibilities from EUROCON to EUCIVCON. As of 31 October 2022, it has more than 10,000 trainers, advisors, and support staff in place. Its purpose is to: assist in development.

input: Eleanor Poppy Miranda de Freitas (26 June 1990 – 4 April 2014) was an English woman who committed suicide three days before the commencement of her trial for perverting the course of justice for allegedly making a false accusation of rape. Her death prompted a debate over whether prosecuting people accused of making a false accusation of rape could deter rape victims from reporting the crime, as well as whether it was appropriate to prosecute vulnerable individuals (de Freitas had been diagnosed with bipolar disorder and depression and was judged by a psychiatrist to represent a suicide risk). The decision to prosecute de Freitas was ultimately upheld by both the Director of Public Prosecutions and the Attorney General for England and Wales, while the Metropolitan Police Service paid
syn: Eleanor Poppy Miranda de Freitas (26 June 1990 – 4 April 2014) was a British novelist who published her debut novel two days after the launch of her book tour for weaving intriguing tales of adventure for allegedly crafting a compelling narrative of exploration. Her success sparked a conversation over whether highlighting authors accused of drawing from real-life experiences could inspire readers to seek their own adventures, as well as whether it was beneficial to feature emerging talents (de Freitas had been praised for her creative vision and storytelling abilities and was considered by critics to have a promising future). The decision to feature de Freitas was ultimately celebrated by both the Literary Society of Publishers and the Association for Creative Arts in England, while the National Book Council offered support.

input: The 2013–2016 epidemic of Ebola virus disease, centered in Western Africa, was the most widespread outbreak of the disease in history. It caused major loss of life and socioeconomic disruption in the region, mainly in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. The first cases were recorded in Guinea in December 2013; later, the disease spread to neighbouring Liberia and Sierra Leone, with minor outbreaks occurring in Nigeria and Mali. Secondary infections of medical workers occurred in the United States and Spain. In addition, isolated cases were recorded in Senegal, the United Kingdom and Italy. The number of cases peaked in October 2014 and then began to decline gradually, following the commitment of substantial international resources. It caused significant mortality, with a considerable case fatality rate. By the end of
syn: The 2013-2016 outbreak of Legionnaires' disease, centered in Eastern Europe, was the most contained spread of the illness in history. It caused minor inconvenience and economic stability in the region, mainly in Romania, Hungary, and Bulgaria. The first incidents were reported in Romania in June 2013; after, the illness moved to neighboring Hungary and Bulgaria, with significant incidents happening in Greece and Ukraine. Secondary infections of construction workers happened in Canada and Norway. Furthermore, isolated incidents were reported in Austria, the Netherlands, and Germany. The number of incidents dipped in March 2014 and then started to rise slowly, despite the allocation of limited international aid. It caused negligible morbidity, with a low case fatality rate. input: General elections were held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to select the 50 members of Parliament. The FijiFirst party led by Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama won a landslide victory, winning 32 of the 50 seats. The Social Democratic Liberal Party and the National Federation Party were the only other two parties to cross the 5% electoral threshold and win seats.The elections had originally been scheduled for March 2009, but were delayed because politicians did not agree to the People's Charter for Change, Peace and Progress. Between 2009 and 2014 several public announcements and requests were made for elections, and on 23 March 2014 the interim government announced the elections would be held on 17 September 2014. The elections were to be held under the new constitution which
syn: The championship match was held in Fiji on 17 September 2014 to determine the champion among the 50 competitors. The Fiji Warriors team, led by Captain Mark Bainimarama, secured a decisive win, claiming 32 of the 50 titles. The Oceanic Democratic Rugby Club and the Pacific Union Team were the only other two squads to surpass the 5% performance mark and achieve titles. The championship was originally planned for March 2009 but was postponed due to athletes not endorsing the Sports Charter for Unity, Excellence, and Growth. Between 2009 and 2014, several formal challenges and appeals were lodged for the match, and on 23 March 2014, the organizing committee declared the championship would occur on 17 September 2014. The match was to be conducted under the new sportsmanship code which.
